dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lush campsite, in the woods. A smattering of RV’s and campers, a few TENTS, spaced out from each other for priv Legend: 1980 VIOLET (7) steps out of a small CAMPER, heading away as h MOTHER leans out of the door. VIOLET’S MOTHER Where are you going, Violet?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Just to pick some flowers! VIOLET’S MOTHER Don’t wander too far!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet moves down the path, stopping to look at some WILD FLOWERS growing beside her. She glances up, seeing SEVERA RV’S and MOTOR HOMES in a cluster, just visible off the p We don’t know it yet, but these belong to the TRUE KNOT. Unaware of their danger, Violet heads further down the pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet emerges into a clearing on the banks of a quiet, pristine river. Sunlight reflecting off the water, lovely wildflowers growing by the bank... She's startled to see a WOMAN sitting by the water, almos hidden by the overgrowth. Holding a fistful of FLOWERS, throwing pedals into the stream as she sings...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: My wild Irish Rose / The sweetest flower that grows / You may search everywhere / But none can compare with my wild Irish Rose... She is beautiful, dressed in flowing, strange clothes and black TOP HAT. She is ROSE THE HAT (looks 30's, but is so much older). She turns to Violet, smiling sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well hi there.  2. Violet stares at Rose’s flowers. BRIGHTER, more COLORFUL the wildflowers she’s found...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Where did you find those?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Oh, these? I know all the secret places. You want one? Violet doesn’t answer. Studies Rose’s face. She has a swe demeanor, a KIND, EARNEST SMILE...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh... you’re wondering why I’m wearing such a funny hat. Well I'll tell you. I always wear this hat. So much it’s part of my name now. My friends, my very best friends, they just call me “Rose the Hat.” You can call me that, now that we're friends.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I like it. It looks like a magician’s hat.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: It is! It’s a magic hat, wanna see? Rose removes her hat. Violet watches, her wariness fading

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take a look. Nothing in my hat, nothing up my sleeves... Violet STEPS FORWARD again, so that she can see inside th hat. It’s EMPTY. Rose turns it over, shaking it for effec A SNAPPING BRANCH draws Violet’s attention. She turns, se a MAN lurking at the edge of the woods. STARING AT HER. H CROW (40's, dressed in dirty clothes.) PERFECTLY STILL.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, he’s my friend. You're missing the trick! Reach inside. Violet hesitates... and then reaches her hand out, into t hat... pulling up a HANDFUL OF BEAUTIFUL FLOWERS.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Wow... they’re so pretty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they’re special. Speaking of special... you’re a little magic too, aren’t you. Rose reaches into the hat, her hand disappearing from vie

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The flower in my hand. What color is it? (off Violet's hesitation) It’s okay, honey. You won’t scare me. I’m not like mom and dad.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Purple. Rose smiles, lifting up a GORGEOUS PURPLE FLOWER. Another SNAPPING TWIG, and Violet looks. There are MORE PEOPLE now, standing at the periphery of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Violet. Like you. She turns. She doesn’t remember telling Rose her name... Rose turns over the hat, and FLOWERS POUR OUT OF IT onto ground. Violet’s eyes light up. She stoops, picking up a of them. Rose does the same -- and EATS a flower, right o the stem.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: You don’t eat flowers!

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Oh, but you do.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: But these are special.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: The special ones taste best. More SNAPS, and Violet turns to see SIX PEOPLE, members o the TRUE KNOT, watching from all around them. Flanking he They are Crow, BARRY THE CHUNK (40's, heavy), GRAMPA FLIC (ancient), APRON ANNIE (30's) and SILENT SAREY (50's).

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I should get back to my mom... She starts to pull away, but CAN’T. She looks down: ROSE’ HAND GRIPS HER FOREARM. TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay a while. See more magic. Violet starts to PULL against Rose’s grip, but it is VICE LIKE. Behind her, THE TRUE KNOT ADVANCES ON HER. SILENT. Their movement STRANGE, INHUMAN - closing in on all sides

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are a special little thing, aren’t you. She squeezes Violet’s arm as the pale faces speed up, barreling toward her silently. Rose’s fingernails DRAW BL on the girl’s forearm. And Rose is STILL SMILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet's mother walks up the path, a little concerned. VIOLET’S MOTHER Vi? Violet! Silence. She glances down at the wildflowers growing by t path, frowning to herself. Behind her, we see the TRUE KN RV’S DRIVING AWAY. She barely glances at them. VIOLET’S MOTHER (CONT’D) (panic growing) Vil Violet! Violet! As her panic grows, the small group of RV’s exit the campground unnoticed as she heads deeper in the woods, calling for a daughter that will not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow. Snow as far as we can see, so bright in the moonlig it almost seems to be giving off its own light. The camer floats above it, tilting up to reveal: THE OVERLOOK HOTEL. Half-buried in the snowfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera follows a boy on a tricycle. We recognize him immediately... YOUNG DANNY TORRANCE (5) riding his tricyc down the familiar hallways. Turning corners, moving fast.  5. He comes to a stop in front of a specific room. ROOM 217. gradually realize why he stopped, and why he stares... TH DOORKNOB IS TURNING. SOOOOO SLOWLY... As he watches, the door CREEPS OPEN, revealing ABYSSAL DARKNESS WITHIN. And then, just as slowly, a FIGURE START MATERIALIZE IN THE INKY BLACKNESS...

dialogues.speaker: BARELY STEPPING OUT OF THE DARK WHEN --
dialogues.text: INT. DANNY’S BEDROOM, FLORIDA - NIGHT -- DANNY'S EYES FLY OPEN. He BOLTS UP in bed, gasping fro the nightmare. COVERED WITH SWEAT, his dream still fresh. catches his breath, and quietly climbs out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door, the name “DANNY” displayed in construction paper, opens as Danny steps into the small condominium. He heads toward the BATHROOM at the end of the hall. The door is CLOSED as he approaches, and he slows down. Surprised to see it closed... He steps toward the door, cautious. Listening. And then, faintly...

dialogues.speaker: WATER... LIKE SOMEONE SHIFTING IN A BATHTUB.
dialogues.text: Danny hesitates. Afraid to open the door, but telling him that he’s being silly -- it’s all in his head... He slowl turns the knob, and OPENS THE DOOR, REVEALING: A WOMAN, IN THE TUB, SITTING IN THE DARK. Lit only by MOONLIGHT. Obscured by the shower curtain. She slowly rea up, pulling the curtain back. We know who she is: MRS. MASSEY. The WOMAN IN THE TUB. Her skin green and bloated, her hands purple with coagulated blood. Her eyes dead and white, like a fish’s belly. We can almost SMELL putrid rot as she GRINS AT DANNY -- The filthy water SLOSHES as she slowly STANDS, naked, her body waterlogged and rotting. A purple foot LIFTS from th water, STEPPING ONTO THE BATHMAT. Danny’s bladder LETS GO, a puddle forming at his feet. She LUMBERS TOWARD HIM as Danny CLOSES THE DOOR, stepping back into the hall.  6. He stares, wide-eyed and terrified as A SHADOW APPEARS UN

dialogues.speaker: TURNS. LEFT, THEN RIGHT.
dialogues.text: Danny COVERS HIS EYES, trying to WILL IT AWAY, even as he hears DEAD FINGERNAILS SCRATCHING ON THE DOOR --

dialogues.speaker: A HAND FALLS ONTO HIS SHOULDER, AND HE SPINS, SCREAMING -
dialogues.text: Into the face of WENDY TORRANCE (30's, exhausted. )

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! It’s okay, it’s okay... He RUNS into her arms, she holds him, alarmed and perplex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy PULLS a fresh pair of pajama bottoms onto Danny.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: There, all dry. What happened? Danny doesn’t answer. Just stares ahead, CATATONIC. WENDY (CONT’D) Danny, you have to talk to me. You haven’t talked since we left that... place. Please, Doc. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy steps down the hall slowly, toward the bathroom doo Steeling herself. Summoning a familiar courage -- a coura she learned at the Overlook. She reaches the doorknob, and only hesitates a moment bef opening the door and turning on the light. The room is empty. Nothing in the tub, nothing out of the ordinary. She exhales. She’s about to leave, hand on the light switch, when she sees -- TWO SHAPES ON THE BATHMAT. WET DEPRESSIONS. FOOTPRINTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sits on a bench, looking out at the marina. Exhaust

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you ain’t talkin’, huh Doc? Reveal DICK HALLORANN (late 50’s, black) sitting beside h

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Weren’t talking much first time I met you, neither. Little boy, set to spend a long winter at that rotten old place, just him and his mommy and daddy -- daddy’s dark as that boy is bright and boy, is he bright -- he’s Shining like fire in the one place - the worst place - for a boy who Shines. (beat) You remember the first time we really talked? When I spoke up inside your head? Danny nods. Dick smiles. And then, Dick keeps talking... his mouth doesn’t move. He speaks IN DANNY’S MIND.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Made you feel good, right? Knowing you weren’t alone?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Daddy tried to kill me. Dick notices that Danny used his “outside” voice, and fol suit. No longer talking in his head.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: It wasn’t all him, you gotta know. That place fed his dark, like it fed on your light. And he had some light in him, too. Just like you got some dark. We all got both --

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It’s not done with me.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: It ever strike you funny, how I showed up when I did? When you needed me? Someone did that for me too. My gramma taught me and I tried to teach you and some day, Danny Torrance, you'll teach someone else-

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you won’t, huh.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I won’t Shine, I mean. No more. It’s dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Reckon it is, sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She found me. She’1l come back and come back until she gets me.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: You're right. Overlook’s condemned. Boarded up. They’re starving old ghosts and they’re reaching out for you. Won’t stop with her, either.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Pictures in a book. You said they were just pictures in a book, and they couldn’t hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Thought they was.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: But they aren’t. They’re real.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Some things, dark things, the Shining’s like food. They're mosquitos, landing for blood. (beat) The Overlook, it was always just pictures to me, but I didn’t Shine like you. Nobody Shines like you. So you, in that damn hotel... you was like a million-watt battery, all plugged in, and it ate it up. You made it real, started soon as you walked through the door.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can't do nothin’ about that, I’m sorry to tell you but you’re not a child, you're older now, much older in a way, and you gotta hear this. World’s a hungry place and the darkest things are the hungriest and they'll eat what Shines. Swarm it. Like mosquitos, or leeches. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can’t do nothing ‘bout that. What you can do is turn what they come for against them. Danny looks up at Dick. His old eyes are sad, weary.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My grandfather, he was a mean sonofabitch. Dark inside, same type of dark as your dad. Beat me senseless, and my gramma too, and when he died I danced but he kept on comin’ back. Standing in my room, suit all grey and stinking, from whatever mold was growing on him in that box. One day he grabbed me and he was real. His nails were overgrown, growing long in the grave and they cut me, Doc. Cut me deep. And Gramma... she taught me a trick. Gave me a present. He reaches into his coat, and removes A SMALL METAL LOCKB Very old, rusted. And, a KEY. On a chain.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to know this box. Inside and out. Don’t just look at it; touch it. Stick your nose inside and see if there’s a smell. Know every corner. Every single thing.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Because you’re gonna build one just like it in your mind. One even more special. So next time that bitch comes ‘round, you’ll be ready. (beat) Let’s get you back to momma. Wendy’1l worry and she shouldn’t have to worry another day in her life; that woman’s paid that debt. They stand from the bench, walking back toward the shops. Further out, Wendy is looking wildly around as she SPOTS Danny approaching. She rushes toward him, relieved... We realize DANNY IS WALKING ALONE. DICK IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: There you are! Where did you go???  10. She hugs him as we PAN OFF of them, resting on a TATTERED MISSING POSTER ON A LIGHT POST... A POSTER OF VIOLET’S FA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Wendy sit on the couch, snuggling as they watch BUGS BUNNY CARTOON. Wendy laughs at the show, Danny smile Content. BETTER. And then, he looks up. Toward the hallwa

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I have to pee. He hops up, and Wendy watches him go. A little concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny turns the corner. Looking at the BATHROOM DOOR. It’ SLIGHTLY OPEN... and he sees what he knew he’d see. MRS. MASSEY, in the tub, BARELY VISIBLE through the door. He takes a breath, and walks toward the bathroom. As he nears, she SITS UP, GRINNING WITH HER ROTTEN TEETH. Danny steps into the door as she CLIMBS TO HER FEET, filth and water dripping from her.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hi Mrs. Massey. (beat) I brought you a present. He CLOSES THE DOOR, we PULL BACK. SLOW. After a few beats MRS. MASSEY SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy looks up as Danny returns. Calm, casual.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: You okay, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, mom. I’m okay. He climbs onto the couch, resting his head on his mother’ shoulder. She can tell... HE’S OKAY. TRULY OKAY. And for first time in a long time, Danny SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DEENIE’S BEDROOM - MORNING DAN TORRANCE (mid 20’s now) awakes with a start. Pale, sweaty. His face BRUISED AND SWOLLEN, fighting through on the worst (and last) hangovers of his life. Legend: 2000 He’s in a FILTHY APARTMENT, a dirty mattress on a dirty floor. He COUGHS, dry-heaving as he holds his throbbing h He rolls over, and stops as he sees -- DEENIE (early 20's, frail and sickly) asleep next to him. Also naked. He stares, trying to remember --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blurry flashes. Hazy memories. Dan, downing a shot of whiskey. And another. Deenie, holding onto him while he shoots pool.

dialogues.speaker: DEENIE
dialogues.text: (slurring) What’s your name again, Cutey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan stares at her. There’s VOMIT next to her mouth, stain her pillow. As the sight and smell hit him -- INT. DEENIE’S BATHROOM - MOMENTS LATER Dan PUKES into the toilet, spitting out a vile mix of bil and whiskey. Fumbles for the handle, barely manages a flu He THROWS water on his face, looking up in the mirror AND SEEING THE CUTS AND BRUISES. One eye almost SWOLLEN SHUT. reaches up, perplexed. Touching the wounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- More whiskey. A LARGE MAN trying to pull Deenie away f him. Dan, getting in the man’s face. A PUNCH that lands D on the ground. Spitting out BLOOD, getting to his feet - familiar DARKNESS in his eyes. -- A hand, grabbing a BILLIARD BALL. Dan, SMASHING THE BA into the man’s head. Straddling him now, as others SCRAMB TO BREAK UP THE FIGHT. Dan’s hand, smashing the ball into man’s head AGAIN. And AGAIN. And AGAIN.  12.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (between blows) You gonna take - your - medicine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan STUMBLES, catching himself on the dresser. Looks down his BLOODY, BRUISED KNUCKLES. HIS HANDS SWOLLEN.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh god... He looks back at the sleeping girl, and then at THE WHITE POWDER, STILL ARRANGED IN SLOPPY LINES, on the nightstand beside her. NEXT TO THE EMPTY WHISKEY BOTTLE. INT. DEENIE’S BEDROOM - THE PREVIOUS NIGHT Dan PULLS HARD from the whiskey, WINCING as Deenie SNORTS LINE OF COKE from the nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: DEENIE
dialogues.text: Holy shit, I think you killed him. What if you killed him. I hope you killed him. I hope you killed him, you hear me? Deenie, STRADDLING HIM NOW.

dialogues.speaker: DEENIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lemme kiss it better. She kisses him, hard, pushing him back onto the mattress. INT. DEENIE’S LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Dan STUMBLES out, pulling his clothes on. Looking at the BLOOD ON HIS SHIRT. Not all of it his... And then he realizes something. He pulls out his WALLET.. CASH. Digs through his pockets. NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Fuck. Fuck... He turns his pockets out, frantic now. All of his money, gone, probably snorted by the naked girl in the other roo HER PURSE. There, on the table. Open. Dan stares at it, a after a long pause, he moves toward it.  13. He opens her wallet, looking through. There’s CASH there, maybe $100. Tens and twenties, crumpled... AND FOOD STAMPS. A pile of food stamps. He slowly removes the cash, conflicted. Looking back thro the open bedroom door, where she snores softly. He POCKET THE CASH, heading toward the door when --

dialogues.speaker: TODDLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mommy? He stops cold. Turns. Standing in the doorway to another bedroom is a TODDLER, maybe 18 months. Staring at him. Da DEFLATES a little. Confused, concerned... humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What’s your name, hero? The kid just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please tell me you came from next door. Or down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: TODDLER
dialogues.text: Momma... Dan sighs. Oh, shit. He goes to the kid. Picks him up -- AND SEES THE BRUISES on the boy’s arms. The kind you get being GRABBED. REALLY HARD. He carries the boy into the bedroom, placing him next to Deenie.

dialogues.speaker: TODDLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Momma! He cuddles against her, and even in her stupor, Deenie wr a hand around him. Dan watches, heart breaking a little. He makes his way toward the door, stopping one last time her purse. Looking at the food stamps, the little boy cud up next to Deenie... And at the CASH in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You can put her money back, Doc. You can do that much. He looks up. Dick is standing in the shadows, HIDDEN.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She took mine. Probably spent it on the coke --  14.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Doc. Dan stares him down. After a moment, tucks the money in h pocket. He turns back, looking at Deenie and the boy. Squints, concentrating. For a moment, a FLASH of -- THE LOCK BOX, with the rusty lock.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no, Doc. You can put things from the Overlook away in boxes, but not memories. Never those. They’re the real ghosts, you take ‘em with you. Dan stares at him defiantly, and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ABRA’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - EVENING DAVID (30's) and LUCY (30’s) turn the corner, following t sound of PIANO MUSIC. Stilted, promising... YOUNG ABRA (5 years old, adorable), sits at the piano in the living roo

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Time for bed, Abra.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: A little more??

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No sweetie, big day tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: Birthday party!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's right. But for now, bedtime. INT. ABRA’S HOUSE, ABRA’S ROOM - MOMENTS LATER David and Lucy tuck Abra into bed. Handing her a STUFFED BUNNY, which Abra CUDDLES happily.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: Abba’s five! Happy birthday Abba!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Not just yet. Goodnight sweetie. They leave her tucked in, closing the door softly.  15. INT. ABRA’S HOUSE, MASTER BEDROOM - LATER David and Lucy are fast asleep. Slowly stirred by a sound PIANO MUSIC, echoing through the dark house. INT. ABRA’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER David and Lucy make their way down the stairs, the music LOUDER NOW. It seems Abra’s snuck out of bed, and gone ba to the piano. As they turn the corner, they STOP COLD. There is no one in the room. But THE PIANO IS PLAYING, th same song Abra was struggling with earlier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDI STEINER (15, sharp and pretty) sits in the dark thea Munching on candy as an older BUSINESSMAN (50s) makes his down the aisle, sitting next to her. She doesn’t look up from her candy as he sits.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Andi?

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: You're prettier than your picture.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You’re older than yours. He looks around, a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: So are we staying here or going somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to watch the movie? He frowns. But soon softens as she SNUGGLES UP to him, la her head on his shoulder. His HAND finds her THIGH. We pull back to reveal ROSE and CROW, sitting a few rows back. Not watching the movie. Watching ANDI.  16.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I don’t see what the fuss is about. Chat room romance. A little gross, but not interesting.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Watch. It’s interesting, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: It better be. Because she’s not all that steamy -

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: There she goes. They watch as Andi PUTS HER LIPS TO HER DATE’S EAR.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Aren’t you tired? Sleep. The man’s head instantly DROPS to his chest. He’s OUT COL She lifts his LIMP HAND off her thigh with disgust, and fishes out his wallet. Starts PULLING CASH, credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Wait. This is the best part. I’ve watched her do it three times now and it never gets old. Andi pulls a PEARL-HANDLED KNIFE from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Sleep deeper. Deep as you can. The pain you'll feel is only a dream. What will the pain be?

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: A dream. She puts her arm around him, and quietly SLASHES TWO TINY into his cheek. The blood FLOWS. He doesn’t even FLINCH.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You can explain a lost wallet, when your wife asks, but you can’t explain this. This, you see every day in the mirror. Every time you see it, you’ll say it out loud... “I like little girls.” She finishes cutting, leaning closer to the sleeping man.  17.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll say it out loud.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Out loud.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: And the next time you go looking for a little girl online, you’1l remember that time you got bit by a rattlesnake. A rattlesnake in a blue skirt and white blouse, whose face is a blank. She kisses his bloody cheek, standing from her chair, qui leaving the theater. Rose and Crow watch, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: That is interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andi walks in the afternoon sun. The street is crowded, s in a city. Behind her, CROW approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: “Scuse me, miss? Miss! She ignores him, walking faster.

dialogues.speaker: CROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You left something in the theater -

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You wanna leave me alone. Crow STOPS. Blinks. Suddenly UNSURE of himself, as if he FORGOT WHY HE WAS CHASING HER. Andi turns to leave when - ROSE GRABS HER ARM.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Well hi there. Andi stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You want to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Oh no, sweetie. No I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan wakes up under the overpass, face down on a filthy to he’d spread out for himself the night before. A fresh bot in front of him, empty. Clutched in his cold fingers. He COUGHS, spitting with his dry mouth. Looking around hi Not even sure how he ended up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan stands at the ticket counter, looking at the crumpled bills in his hands. His hands SHAKE, he’s DIRTY. Exhauste

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How far can I get for... He counts out the bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the bus sign: FRASIER, NH. Passengers board quie and Dan is among them. The last of his cash apparently we to the BOTTLE he clutches, along with his beat-up knapsac

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ABRA’S HOUSE, BACKYARD - AFTERNOON DOZENS of kids and parents pack the yard, decorated for Abra’s birthday party. David and Lucy watch Young Abra, dressed in a birthday tiara and carrying her STUFFED BUNN run toward them holding out a handmade card.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: Mommy! I made this for you -- It’s a secret card! Abra bounds away, toward the MAGICIAN who is gathering th kids at the end of the yard. Lucy looks down at the card. Just a simple word: hELL© The MAGICIAN holds out a red TOP HAT to the kids.

dialogues.speaker: MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Nothing up my sleeves, nothing up my sleeves... He reaches in, pulling out a WHITE RABBIT. The kids clap giggle, and he hands it to Abra.  19. MAGICIAN (CONT’D) Abracadabra!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: I know magic too!

dialogues.speaker: MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Well you get to hold him, birthday girl. She pets the bunny, watching. He turns over the hat, and SILVER SPOONS fall out. The ki laugh, delighted, as he picks them up and starts HANGING ON HIS FACE, the last one balanced on the tip of his nose

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: That’s nice, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is over, the last of the kids trickling out. Da and Lucy clean up as Abra plays with the last of her frie David frowns at the birthday cake.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We can forget nap time.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Just a few more hours. Say it with me, just a few more hours -- She smiles at him, heading through the open sliding glass door into the house. As he carefully scoops up the cake -

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (alarmed) David... INT. ABRA’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER David enters the kitchen, where Lucy stares. White as a sheet. She’s pointing... THE SILVERWARE DRAWERS ARE ALL OUT, as though they SHOT O FORKS AND KNIVES ALL OVER THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What the hell...  20.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Dave... Lucy POINTS AT THE CEILING. He follows her gaze -- ALL OF THE SPOONS are hanging from the ceiling. Dangling, though magnetized. Their tips barely touching the plaster They STARE at it as Abra enters. Stuffed bunny in her han

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: (proud) Abra... cadabra!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Honey, did... did you do this? Abra’s smile fades. Her lip starts to quiver.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: Am I in trouble? They stare at her, not sure what to say -- as she STARTS CRY, to REALLY LET LOOSE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan STARTLES awake in his seat. SENSING SOMETHING, someth that woke him... as though REACTING TO THE FALLING SPOONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose STOPS in her tracks as she heads toward her RV, also SENSING SOMETHING. Looking over her shoulder. A passing thought, but something... some thing... INT. ROSE’S RV, LONG ISLAND - MOMENTS LATER Rose steps into the trailer. The moment forgotten as she heads toward ANDI, who is just waking up on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Hi there, sleepyhead. Sorry, I had to sleep you pretty hard, you’re a tough one. Willful.  21. Andi sits up, rubbing her head. Taking in her surrounding

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know I checked... six men, in three months. With those little snakebite tattoos on their cheeks. You've been busy. (beat) Snakebite Andi, that’s who you are. So who am I...

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You're some crazy bitch that kidnapped me -- Rose holds up a finger. One finger, and Andi is SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Just the truth, from now on. You’1l only say the truth.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: (beat) You’re the most beautiful woman I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Well golly. Works a little too well, don’t it. Here’s the deal, Snakebite Andi. You’re a pusher. You can push people, and we haven't had a pusher round here for a little while so I’m gonna offer you a deal I haven’t offered anyone in almost forty years.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: No way you’re forty.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: How old are you, darling?

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Fifteen. God, what an age. The Springtime of your womanhood, isn’t it, you're not a girl anymore but you don’t have a single dent yet, either. Gravity hasn’t even noticed you, not at fifteen. (beat) Men, though...  Andi lowers her head.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! No shame, and you paid that back, didn’t you. What I’m offering, Snakebite Andi, is just that: Springtime. Springtime forever. Ten years from now, you’re still fifteen. A hundred years, maybe you’re seventeen. Live long, stay young. Eat well.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Sounds too good to be true.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I know it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: So you and your friends out there -—

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: They're not my friends, they’re my family. We’re the True Knot, dear.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: (snickers) True Knot.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What’s tied can never be untied. Andi laughs. Rose, though, isn’t laughing.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Do I have any other choice?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Only bad ones, dear. But it’s better if you want it. Makes the turning easier.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: (beat) Does it hurt? Rose smiles, and lies.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Not at all. cur 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan steps away from the bus station. Tired, beaten. Shuff through town, not even sure where he’s going. It’s MAIN STREET New Hampshire, the evening hours seeing the street mostly deserted. A small town, with character. He stops at a sign: VISIT TEENEY TOWN! FRASIER’S SMALL WONDER. He looks beyond it, smiling to himself as he beho Teeneytown. It’s a MINIATURE REPLICA of the very street h on, a tiny representation of the town he’s in. Around it, a SMALL TRAIN - designed for toddlers - restin idle on its tracks. Dan smiles. It’s strange, but welcomi at the same time. He crouches, examining the locomotive.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You like it? Dan spins to face BILLY FREEMAN (late 40’s, kind.)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was just -

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: That’s okay, people love to look at it. Model train buffs, usually. We keep em away in the summer when the place is jumpin’, but this time of year there’s no we, just me. And I don’t mind. (holds out his hand) Billy Freeman. Town maintenance.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Dan Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Just off the bus? Or you ridin’ your thumb?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Bus. What does this thing have for an engine?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Now that’s interesting. You ever hear of the Chevrolet Veraneio?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Brazilian Suburban, wasn’t it? Turbodiesel.  24.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: That's right! Instrument panel’s from a Suburban too. Seats I put in myself. (beat) What brings you to town, Dan Torrance?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not sure yet.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Not many take the bus this far North, less they’re looking for work. You lookin’ for work?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I am. Place to stay, too.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Change of scenery? Or you running away from something? Don’t mind my asking, I hope. New face is all.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) Running away from myself I guess.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know that look. Pretty well, sorry to say. (smiles) Runnin’ away from yourself’s a pickle. You take yourself with you, wherever you go.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Ain't that the bitch.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (considering) I know Mr. Kingsley, from the program, he helps folks out now and again, if they’re worthy of help, that is. You got references?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: A few. Mostly janitorial, hospital orderly stuff.  25. INT. DAN’S ROOM, ELLIOT STREET - EVENING Dan stands by as MRS. ROBERTSON (40’s) gives him a tour o the LOFTY ROOM, at the top of the building. A view of the mountains, a simple room. A bed, a bath. Billy watches on

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROBERTSON
dialogues.text: Rent’s eighty-five a week, payable upfront. Billy paid your first two, the rest are on you. Once you start getting paid at Teeneytown. No pets, no parties, no noise. Dan looks at Billy, surprised. Billy just watches.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m a quiet tenant.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROBERTSON
dialogues.text: Last guy said the same. Math student. Even let him paint the wall all blackboard, so he could scribble his little puzzles up there. She walks to the wall adjacent to the bed. A wall painted over DARK, with CHALKBOARD PAINT. She reaches down, picki up one of several pieces of COLORED CHALK by the wall. MRS. ROBERTSON (CONT’D) (writing) Wasn’t quiet, no sir. Didn’t even paint over this when he left, but I’m glad he didn’t so I can make this easy for you... so you see it every morning, when you wake. She steps back, revealing the writing: “85/wk. BEHAVE.” S walks past him, stopping for a beat beside Billy. MRS. ROBERTSON (CONT’D) You sure you wanna vouch for this pup?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROBERTSON
dialogues.text: It’s your ass, Billy. She leaves, and Dan looks to Billy. A long beat.  26.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I’m downstairs, ground floor, if you need anything. Find me tomorrow and we'll talk about some work.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? You don’t know me.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No I don’t. But I know the look, like I said, and... sometimes I get feelings about people. Hard to understand, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) Easier than you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andi lays flat on a lawn recliner, near the group of RV's The sounds of the waves, a sky full of blinking stars overhead. A FIRE BURNING in the center. She’s nervous. Around her, the members of the TRUE KNOT stand. Rose in h hat, Crow beside her. Apron Annie, Barry the Chunk, Silen Sarey watch as Grampa Flick regards them with ancient eye

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No fear.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Who are these people -

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You'll find out, after. But this here is Grampa Flick, and he’ll lead us. No fear, understand? Rose nods to Grampa Flick, who steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA FLICK
dialogues.text: We are the True Knot and we endure.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Sabbatha hanti.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA FLICK
dialogues.text: We are the chosen ones.  27.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Lodsam hanti.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA FLICK
dialogues.text: We are the fortune ones.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Cahanna risone hanti.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA FLICK
dialogues.text: What is tied cannot be untied. Here is a woman. Would she join us? Would she tie her life to our life?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Say yes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Yes. Rose reaches down, lifting a SILVER CANISTER. Almost like THERMOS, but older. STRANGER. She holds it near Andi’s fa Rose TURNS THE VALVE on the canister. A small, rueful sig and a PUFF of silver MIST escapes. But it doesn’t dissipa into the night air... IT HANGS.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: This one’s special. Her name’s Violet, and there’s not much of her left... she tastes like flowers. Rose gently purses her lips, BLOWING the pocket of mist softly. It FLOATS around Andy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Breathe deep. After a beat, Andi BREATHES IT IN. ROSE HOLDS HER DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Embrace it. It’s the only way through. Andi SCREAMS in pain, shaking VIOLENTLY in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take steam or die. Andi CONVULSES, and as they stare at her, HER SKIN BEGINS CHANGE -- BECOMING TRANSLUCENT, TRANSPARENT, in FLASHES - CYCLING between human and something else --  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan is asleep in bed. Out the window, snow falls hard. A SHUFFLING SOUND in the corner slowly stirs him. He opens eyes. Squints into the darkness... there’s nothing. But he becomes aware of something else. FLIES, buzzing ar him. He realizes SOMEONE HAS THEIR ARM DRAPED OVER HIM -- DEAD ARM, ROTTING. FLIES CRAWLING ALL OVER IT. He carefully reaches down, trying to LIFT THE ARM away, w he starts to roll over TO SEE THE ROTTING SKIN of A NAKED YOUNG WOMAN laying in bed beside him. HE SLOWLY tries to drop to the floor beside the bed, almo extricating himself from her grip when HER DEAD HAND GRAB HIS ARM. He SHOUTS, and she slowly ROLLS OVER TO FACE HIM IT’S DEENIE. Eyes clouded over, BLOOD AND VOMIT coming fr her nose and mouth. LIKE SHE DIED OF AN OVERDOSE. She SMI and when she speaks, she’s speaking through PHLEGM.

dialogues.speaker: DEENIE
dialogues.text: They haven’t found us yet. He GASPS. CLOSES HIS EYES -- BUT SHE GRIPS HARDER, and wh he opens his eyes HER FACE IS INCHES FROM HIS OWN.

dialogues.speaker: DEENIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They were used to hearing him cry, ‘cuz I left him alone so much... so they didn’t do anything, and they haven’t found us yet... He stares. The flies CRAWL OVER HER OPEN, SIGHTLESS EYES. Dan notices something else -- A SMALLER HAND, also PALE A ROTTEN, CLINGING TO DEENIE. She reveals the TODDLER, cudd against her. DEAD AS WELL.

dialogues.speaker: TODDLER
dialogues.text: Mama -- Dan SCREAMS. And SCREAMS. And the room is EMPTY. He SHAKE the ground, overwhelmed with horror. CRAWLS FAST toward t bag at the foot of his bed, GRABBING FOR -- THE BOTTLE OF WHISKEY, half full, inside. He PULLS OFF TH CAP, bringing it toward his lips --  29. BUT STOPS THIS TIME. STARES AT IT. FOR A LONG TIME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand KNOCKS on a door. After a few long moments, the do opens, revealing BILLY. Blinking at the late hour. Dan st in the doorway, TEARS ALL OVER HIS FACE. AT ROCK BOTTOM.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You said you knew my look. What’d you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You're sick and you’re tired, I can see that much. But are you sick and tired of being sick and tired? After a long beat, Dan says the words he’s struggled to s for so long. The most important words he’1ll ever say.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I need help. Billy nods. Smiles gently.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Come on in. Let’s talk about it. He steps aside, and Dan comes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of RECOVERING ADDICTS sits in the dimly lit churc basement. At the podium, the moderator DR. JOHN (mid 60's stands to speak, leading the group in the prayer.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: God, grant me the Serenity, to accept the things I cannot change, courage to change the things I can, and wisdom to know the difference. Dr. John smiles at the room, holding out a box of CHIPS.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Anyone here have a year? Six months?  30. An ADDICT gets up, applause as they take their chip.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three months? Thirty days? (as someone approaches) Congrats brother. He looks out at the group. DR. JOHN (CONT’D) And now for the most important person in the room. Anyone here a newbie? Someone got 24 hours? Reveal DAN, sitting beside Billy. Tears in his eyes. Bill smiles, encouraging, and after a moment, Dan STANDS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Billy stand by the coffee machine, looking down a the ONE DAY CHIP in his hands. Turning it over. Around hi small talk and handshakes, some hugs. Dr. John approaches, pouring his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Billy says you’re new to town.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: John.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Doctor John’s been serving the town most of my life. Delivered my little brother.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Small towns. How you holding up Billy?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Train’s still runnin’. Dan notices Dr. John rubbing his wrist, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay?  31.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, just... lost something. Emma’s gonna kill me. Well good to know you, Dan. Come back. Hope to see you again soon. They SHAKE HANDS. And in that moment, Dan KNOWS SOMETHING watches Dr. John walking away.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Good man. Really holds us together, got a gift for -

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hang on. He follows Dr. John, reluctant.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Doc... your watch. Dr. John stops. Turns, looking at him quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You lost your watch. You were worried about the kid with Goocher’s.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: (beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The kid. Goochers? Glutchers? Some sort of bone thing.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: (long beat) Gaucher's disease.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... the terminal ones always bother you, and you washed your hands, the hospital bathroom, you left it on top of the soap dispenser. Your wife gave it to you, it was your wedding present. Dr. John stares. Not sure what to make of this.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Check on top of the soap dispenser. Dr. John nods, and starts to walk away. Dan sighs.  32.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: How’d you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the WATCH, back on Dr. John’s wrist.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Wish I could say. Lucky guess.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Guess my ass... (beat) Billy said you have orderly experience.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: You working right now?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Few shifts at Teeneytown. Helping with the train, couple hours a day. Dr. John sits back. Considering.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Well listen, I owe you a debt. However you did it. (beat) I do three days a week at Rivington House. Hospice. Tough to find good orderlies, tougher to keep ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That sounds good to me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Dying people don’t bother you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We're all dying. Whole world’s a hospice with fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Done. Because you’re a friend of Bill’s.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Billy’s got a lot of pull in this town.  33.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Not Billy. Bill. We’re both friends of Bill’s; Billy is too.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. JOHN
dialogues.text: Keep comin’ to the meetings. You'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andi lays on the recliner, the sound of the surf starting bring her back. She blinks into the sun. The True Knot ar enjoying the beach, looking like relaxed campers. Grillin reading, enjoying the sun and the sand. As they see her, SMILE. Some CLAPPING.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Well hi there. Andi blinks. Rose’s hat almost blots out the sun.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: How... how long was I...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Few days.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You said it didn’t hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Doesn't now, does it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: I felt like I was dying --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You brought me back.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Couldn't have done it on my own. You wanted to come, so you came. You'll feel better when you eat.  34. She sits beside her, touching her knee. Gently.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Am I still human?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Do you care? (beat) You’re home. You’re where you belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy tucks Young Abra into bed. Puts the bunny in her arm

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: (off her frown) What is it? Lucy doesn’t answer. YOUNG ABRA (CONT’D) (realizes) You're scared of me.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We love you more than anything in the world, you hear me? Anything.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ABRA
dialogues.text: I didn’t do the spoons. I just pretended it was me but it was the real magician. From the party, it was a birthday party trick he did for me and you and daddy shouldn’t be scared, it wasn’t me. It’s a clumsy lie. A child’s lie... but a kind lie. And p of Lucy appreciates it, even though she knows better.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Goodnight, my heart. She kisses Abra, and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan MOPS THE FLOORS of the darkened halls. Sparely decora patient rooms lined up left and right. As he does, he alm mops over a CAT, who scuttles out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, Azzie. The cat moves down the hall, SCRATCHING at a patient’s do before pushing it open and slipping inside. Dan moves alo lost in his work, as he passes the room. Glances inside. An elderly PATIENT (80’s) lays on the bed, and Azzie the perches at the foot of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, leave him be. The cat doesn’t budge. Shrugging, Dan starts to walk away but STOPS. A feeling comes over him. He turns back, opening the door further. The cat just sta almost like it’s STANDING GUARD. Waiting for something. D looks at it for a long time... and then steps into the ro INT. PATIENT’S ROOM, RIVINGTON HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Dan steps inside, feeling uneasy. The patient STIRS.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Doc? Doc, that you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) No, it’s... I’m not a doctor. Just cleaning up, you want me to call you a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: C’mere. Please. Dan steps toward him, leaning the mop on the desk. The ma looks SICK. One foot almost in the grave.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cat’s on my bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I can take him out --  36.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: No, I knew he would be. That cat... always seems to know when it’s time. Guess it’s time.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No, it’s just Azreel being a silly old cat --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Nope. Been that way since I got here. The cat knows when it’s time to go to sleep, everybody knows that. I’m gonna die. Dan hesitates... then REACHES OUT, taking the man’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes. You are. I’ll get someone --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Stay with me. Please. Dan sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Known it’s comin’. Doesn’t make it less scary.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (long beat) I know what scared feels like. But tell you what, maybe it’s what you said. Just going to sleep. Nothing to be scared of, sleeping. Maybe you wake up some place better.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: You’re a strange type of Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m not a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: I think y’are. (laughs ) Doctor Sleep. You'll stay, right? The man sighs, relieved. Looks up at the ceiling.  37.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m just scared, Doc, scared it'll hurt or be dark or be nothin’ at all, and I don’t wanna -- Dan CLOSES HIS EYES, CONCENTRATING. PROJECTING...

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (in the man’s mind) Nothing to be scared of. The man CALMS, listening as though it’s his own thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Just going to sleep. Finally. True, restful sleep.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: Thank you, Doc. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I shouldn’t be here, let me get you a real doctor --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: No, this is exactly where you should be. Exactly. (beat) I see my wife... And then, one LONG, RATTLING BREATH. As Dan stares -- A FINE CLOUD OF RED MIST rises from the patient’s mouth. Tendrils of red smoke, gently rising from his mouth and n Dan watches the small cloud of mist HOVER above the bed.. AND DISSIPATES into the air with a sigh. Then, the patien perfectly still. IT’S OVER. Dan watches as Azzie the cat GLIDES DOWN from the bed, ca leaving the room. Heading back into the hallway. Dan sits there for a long time, looking at the man. And realizes, for the first time in years, a PURPOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan steps into his room, still in his scrubs. Something different about him now. Something profound. He seems PEACEFUL, settled.  38. He moves to the bed, sitting to remove his shoes... and notices something odd. On the blackboard, ALL OF THE WRIT HAS BEEN ERASED. No more rent, no more “behave.” In its place, a single word: hELL© Dan stares it for a long time. Processing. And then... wa to the board. Picks up a piece of chalk, and writes: “HI”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her bed, in the dark, Abra GIGGLES. Like she heard him and then, rolls over to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sits. He stares at the writing for a long, long time. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow piled up. The hotel dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FLOAT through the corridors. The sound of OLD-TIMEY MU coming from somewhere deep, deep within the rooms... echo through the halls, a ghost in its own right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We float into the ballroom. Toward the FAMILIAR BAR, illuminated from below. No one in sight, but the MUSIC IS COMING FROM HERE. Come to rest in a CLOSEUP of A GLASS OF WHISKEY.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Your credit is fine, Mister Torrance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on an EIGHT-YEAR CHIP... in DAN’S HANDS. Eight year older now (late 30's), CLEAR-EYED and sober. Around him, people CLAP as he takes his chip. He turns to face the ro Legend: 2008

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Dan, alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Hi Dan. From the chairs, Billy cups his hands to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Speech!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m not a speech guy, so I figured I'd hold the chip and talk about whatever popped up. So here I am, and... I’m thinking about my dad. I saw a chip like this in his hand, couple of months before he died. 5- month chip, I’m pretty sure. He hurt me once, when he was drunk, broke my arm, then he dried right out. He looks at the chip, and then at the group.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He died when I was 5, so the only way I ever got to know my dad, really know him, was when I went dark. When I drank, to dull the... or every time I wanted to break someone's face. The drinking and the temper. Those things in me, they were his and they were all I could know of him. (beat) But now... now I get to know hima little different. Cause he also stood in a room like this once, wanting to get well. For me. And my mom. He held a chip in his hand, a chip that said 5 months and on that day, anyway, before the hotel... Dan collects himself.  40.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On that day, all he wanted in the world was to stand where I’m standing right now. And here I am. (beat) So thank you, I guess, from us both. This is for Jack Torrance. He takes the chip, returning to his seat. Billy puts a ha on his shoulder as the next person stands. INT. CHARLIE’S ROOM, RIVINGTON HOUSE - NIGHT CHARLIE (90's), stirs in his bed. Soft lamplight beside h as he looks through wrinkled eyelids... TO THE CAT, sitting calmly at the foot of his bed. He sta at it, sighing. Then turns to the chair beside him, where sits. He smiles at Charlie in the warm lamplight. There’s something different in Dan’s demeanor... he is COMFORTABLE in this role now. Used to it. It’s WHO HE IS.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hi Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Doc. (beat) I guess I don’t need to ask why you're here, this hour.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Any pain? I can get Claudette to bring you a pill.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Pill won't matter. I’ve heard about these house calls. What a visit from Doctor Sleep really is. So what do you see? Dan puts his hand on the man’s forehead, gentle and calm.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Your twin sons at four. See them?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (beat) I do... I can actually see them...  41.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: A Farmall tractor with a striped umbrella over the seat. Five years old, pulling a red wagon --

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Lord, look at that -- like a deck of cards, all out of order... (beat) I’m not scared of hell, Doc. I lived a decent life. And I don’t think there’s such a place anyway. I guess I’m scared there’s nothing. There was nothing before, so what if there’s nothing after...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We don’t end, Charlie. I know that for certain. Don’t know much else, but I know we don’t end.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can taste blueberries, the blueberries my mother used to grow... you taste those?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I do. And I hear Frank, singing on the old radio, on your workbench, by your tools... (singing) Come fly with me, come fly, let’s fly away... Charlie smiles, a tear rolling down his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: DAN AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If you can use some exotic booze, there's a bar in far Bombay... Come fly with me, let's fly, let's fly away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan steps into his room, peeling off the work day. He tur toward the blackboard, pausing as he sees a message in ch MORNIN’

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Been a minute, little pen pal...  42. He walks to the board. Writes a single word in response:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see ABRA (13 now, the same brightness in her eyes). Sh smiles. Rolling her eyes a little.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Abra! School!

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Fine, I know. She pops headphones in as she grabs her backpack, checkin herself in the mirror. Then, she’s off into the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The various RV’s of the True Knot are inconspicuously par at another campground. CROW hops out of his truck, passin GRAMPA FLICK as he grills.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Gramps. You seen Rose?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA FLICK
dialogues.text: Watchtower. He looks at him as he passes. Grampa Flick looks ILL... h hair almost white. Skin pale. Older than we saw him last. He finds Rose SITTING ON TOP OF HER CAMPER, hat perched o her head. Indian style. Looking out at the trees.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Getting closer. We’re heading in the right direction. I just need another day or two. I’1l find him. (beat) But til I do, you gotta open a canister.  43.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We took steam six months ago. Six months, that’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Rosie - that kid in Delaware wasn’t so steamy, and it’s already showing. You've seen Grampa Flick’s hair, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: I don’t think he’s well.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Grampa Flick hasn’t been well since Nixon was in office.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: I know. But lately... anyway, we need to eat. All of us. Are the canisters low?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Course not. Just no need to waste one, if you’re close to the kid.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: I might need it just to find him. (beat) Used to be more steam in the world.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Don’t be daft. That’s like when Rubes say “fifty years ago, people used to be more neighborly.”

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: But it’s true, Rose. There’s less steam out there, and weaker, too. I don’t know if it’s their cell phones or their diets or their Netflix or what, but I’m not picking up many scents these days, and the ones I do -

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I‘1l open a canister tonight. Just to tide everyone over. He nods. Relieved. Heads back toward the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: You know it, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: That's why you sit up here, every day. That’s why you’re always up here, no matter what you tell the others. World’s not as steamy, and you're looking for a whale. Rose watches him go. And looks out at the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks at the COLLECTION OF SILVER CANISTERS. She sig There’s only a FEW LEFT. She picks up a canister, and tur it over in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The True Knot have gathered around the campfire. Rose sta at the center, looking out at the HUNGRY FACES of the gro They stare GREEDILY at the canister in her hand. She crouches down, OPENING THE VALVE. A HISS, and the SIL MIST leaks out. Spreading out like an UMBRELLA OVER HER.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Take nourishment, and endure. They gather around, descending on the mist, SLURPING IT I As they do, we watch THEIR SKIN changing, becoming TRANSLUCENT, the GRINNING SKULLS WITHIN visible as Rose s back, watching. Frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids playing baseball. Neighborhood uniforms, a boys and girls club. We’re watching the game, nothing unusual... a then we see BRADLEY TREVOR (12) step to the plate. ON THE BLEACHERS: parents and kids watch on. One of the SPECTATORS leans to the man next to him.  45.

dialogues.speaker: SPECTATOR
dialogues.text: Watch this kid - number 19. He’s a natural. Hits it every time. Like he can read the pitcher’s mind. REVEAL CROW sitting behind them. WATCHING INTENTLY. At the plate, Brad smiles just as the pitch is thrown... SENDS THE BALL SCREAMING over the shortstop’s head. The c CHEERS, and Crow smiles. SPECTATOR (CONT’D) See? You watch, one of these days some talent scout’s gonna get wind of Brad, there. You watch. Behind him, Crow just smiles. He already has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad walks along the road, LONG ROWS OF CORN on either si of him. Still in his uniform, carrying his bag and his gl Walking home, smiling. Behind him, we realize a VEHICLE IS APPROACHING from the distance. A VAN. It slows behind him, and he STEPS TO THE SIDE of the road to let it pass. It pulls up beside him. Barry leans out of the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Hey! 19! Just saw your game, you’re ready for the majors! Well played!

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: (wary) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: You heading home? Hop in, I'll give you a ride. Brad keeps walking, the van keeping pace.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: It’s real close, I’m good. The sliding door opens, and Snakebite Andi leans out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Brad STOPS walking. Staring at her.  46.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're friends. You wanna hop in, we'll take you right home.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: You can take me right home.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You trust me.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: I trust you. He climbs into the van, and the door closes behind him. Driving calmly away, past the rows of corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicles of the True Knot are parked at the old plant Nothing around them for miles. They all watch on as Barry gently lays Brad in the center of the circle. He’s bound DUCT TAPE, and he’s WEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Please take me home... I won’t tell. I won’t tell. Please... Barry PICKS UP THE GLOVE. Number 19 carved into the leath

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Number 19. Kid, you were good. Barry PUTS HIS HAND into the glove, TRYING IT ON as Rose drops to one knee beside Brad. Touching his hair.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: It’s not personal. Rose steps away from him, looking out at the others with smile on her face. She steps toward Andi, who watches as hands rose a SMALL KNIFE. Short, but VERY SHARP. She starts walking back toward Brad, who notices the knif

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Are you going to hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Yes.  47. As the group tightens their circle around him, they hold flashlights so that Rose can sees what she’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pain purifies steam, dear boy. Fear, too. So you understand. And just like that, she brings the knife to his torso. We STAY ON BRAD’S FACE as his eyes go wide, and we hear a fa SLICING SOUND. He SCREAMS, LOUD. SO LOUD. Rose sits back, looking at his mouth and nose. Frowning, reaches down and GOES BACK TO WORK, her hand moving off- screen as Brad’s scream becomes GUTTURAL. PRIMAL. And then, as his scream of PURE AGONY starts to cease -

dialogues.speaker: A TINY CLOUD, SO SMALL, OF SILVER STEAM RISES FROM HIS LI
dialogues.text: Around him, the members of the True Knot GREEDILY LEAN

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. Good start. Brad pants. Eyes wide with shock and pain. His eyes trave down, to where Rose clutches the BLOODY KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Please -

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We're just getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra is ASLEEP IN BED as we PUSH INTO A CLOSEUP. Her brow furrows. She’s having A BAD DREAM.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (asleep) No... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's SCREAMS CONTINUE, becoming harsh BARKS of pain. Al inhuman. His eyes are wild, BLOOD SPRAYING up onto his ch and cheeks from Rose’s work below.  48. Another small CLOUD OF STEAM rises, and again the True Kn LEAN DOWNWARD, almost like a football huddle, BREATHING GREEDILY as the steam spreads among them --

dialogues.speaker: GRINNING SKULLS AND GLITTERING EYES --
dialogues.text: BRAD SCREAMS AGAIN underneath them, but it is pointless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra BURSTS UP in her bed, HYPERVENTILATING. Panicking. Trying to shake the dream.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Stop... stop... stop... She shakes her head, FREAKING OUT. Squints her eyes,

dialogues.speaker: A KNIFE IN A BLOOD-SOAKED HAND, OVER A BASEBALL JERSEY.
dialogues.text: BRAD’S SCREAMING FACE. THE TRANSLUCENT, GRINNING SKULL/FA

dialogues.speaker: OF THE MONSTERS LEANING OVER HIM, EYES SPARKLING WITH GRE
dialogues.text: And a WOMAN, IN A TOP HAT. WHO SLOWLY TURNS TO LOOK AT HE EXT. ABANDONED ETHANOL PLANT — CONTINUOUS Rose suddenly STOPS HER WORK. Looks over her shoulder. As AWARE SOMEONE IS WATCHING HER... Crow notices her express

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: (quietly) What is it? Rose just looks up at him. Brad STARES at the sky. Tears blood all over his face.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: (weak) Just kill me...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Soon, dear. And then, her hands go back to work, and again, his BARKS AGONY fill the night as the Knot huddles around him, gree waiting for the next morsel of food to rise from his mout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra starts SCREAMING HER HEAD OFF. THRASHING ON THE BED. SCREAMING LIKE BRAD is screaming, so many miles away. The lights TURN ON, and David and Lucy RUN IN, TERRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Abra! Abra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan is asleep in his own bed, when A BLAST, A SHOCKWAVE, FOLLOWED BY A LOUD CRACKING SOUND as Dan HITS THE FLOOR, HARD. GRABBING HIS HEAD, in PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose SPINS WILDLY over her shoulder. She FELT IT TOO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan struggles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Jesus! He stands, not even noticing that his NOSE IS BLEEDING. H eyes go to the mirror on the wall by his headboard -- WHERE SOMETHING TAKES HIS BREATH AWAY. He stares. All his breath stopped in his head. In the mir he can see the CHALKBOARD WALL reflected... A WORD CRACKED INTO THE VERY PLASTER, LARGE AND BOLD.

dialogues.speaker: REDRUM
dialogues.text: He stares at it, and slowly turns away from the glass, to the wall, where the word MURDER stares down at him. He walks to it, very slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. SCARED, he picks up the chalk. And writes one word back:  50.

dialogues.speaker: WHO
dialogues.text: He slowly turns, walking back to the bed. Shaking, he sit down, and makes himself look back at the wall, where the answer has already appeared in chalk. BASEBALL BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad stares ahead as his body finally GIVES OUT. A long D RATTLE from his throat, and the Knot lean closer, GETTING LAST OF THE STEAM as it rises from his mouth. Sucking it Rose sits back.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Damn, I thought he had another few minutes in him.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: He made it three hours, we can’t complain. She picks up a silver canister. She looks up to Grampa Flick... WHOSE HAIR IS A LIGHT BRO AGAIN, the silver long gone. His wrinkles seem BETTER, smoother. He looks TEN YEARS YOUNGER, EASY. As they disperse, Rose PRESSES ON THE BOY’S CHEST, lookin for little traces of steam that might be hiding inside. S holds the canister, and the steam rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra rocks back and forth, sobbing as her parents hold he

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: They killed him. They killed him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sits on the bed, looking at the word on his wall. Pal scared. Over his shoulder, that familiar word in the mirr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Crow finish BURYING THE BODY in the dirt, as the morning sun creeps up. The others are inside their vehicl resting, ready to go. She shovels a heap of dirt onto the growing pile. Almost done. She sits back, resting her head on the handle of th shovel. And after a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We had a looker. Crow stops. Turns to her, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Big steam?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Huge. Huge.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: East Coast I think.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: (beat) You're saying someone looked in from fifteen hundred miles away?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Maybe further.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Boy or girl?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Think it was a girl, but she was out of there in a flash but then she screamed, and I swear, Crow Daddy... I haven’t felt power like that, raw power like that, in so long...  52.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: We should look into it. Sooner than later, I guess. In case her parents freak out, send her to a psychiatrist, they get her on pills -- could ruin the steam, muffle her just when we need --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: If I got it right, and I’m pretty sure I did, giving Paxil to this kid would be like throwing a piece of Saran Wrap over a searchlight. (beat) I don’t know where she is, but I do think she’ll come back. And when she does, I’ll know a lot more. A lot more. They go back to burying the little baseball boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan finishes getting dressed, ready to head out for his d He stops, though, staring at the wall. He’s going to have clean that up at some point... He ERASES the chalk that’s there, running his fingers ove the cracks in the plaster. Before he goes, he reaches dow holding a piece of chalk. CONSIDERING. Finally, writing. As he heads for the door, we REVEAL the words he wrote: I hope you’re okay. Your friend, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra bounds into the kitchen, where Lucy sits at the tabl Sipping coffee... watching her daughter CAREFULLY.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Morning! She watches as Abra heads to the fridge, grabbing some st

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess what! I made a new friend, his name’s Dan.  53.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: At school?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (thinks fast) No, he doesn’t live here. I mean he lives close, Frazier I think. No big deal.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (beat) Are you okay? Last night --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m okay. I’m sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Just a nightmare, huh? Abra... I know that head of yours is like a radio sometimes, and you pick up some... weird stations --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I told you, I don’t -- nothing weird like that, not anymore --

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I only need to know you’re okay. You're safe, right? You’re okay?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Of course, mom. I’m gonna be late. She bounds out of the kitchen. Lucy watches, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra sits at one of the LIBRARY COMPUTERS, headphones in ears. Around her, other kids form small pockets, talking living their normal lives. But Abra is on the outside. Abra takes off her headphones, looking around the room. W realize why she prefers the music -- SHE CAN HEAR THEIR THOUGHTS. We catch SNIPPETS as she scans the room: My god I’ve gotta study if I don’t study I don’t know... Fifty two, running play -- handoff to eleven and -- coach gonna kill me if I don’t get these, c’mon... Why doesn’t he like me? My hair? I should change my hair.  54. She looks at the other kids, trying not to notice the OCCASIONAL STARE. As she stares at one girl, she hears --

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The freak is staring at me again... what is she staring at, freak... Abra quickly turns away. Pulls the headphones up, the cho of thought-whispers is drowned out. She turns back to the computer... looking at the NATIONAL CENTER FOR EXPLOITED MISSING CHILDREN. She scrolls through LISTINGS, the faces the nation’s missing children. So, so many...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra comes in the door. David sits at the table, doing so work on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey Abba-doo.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Hey dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: School okay?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: How’s the book?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good! I’m writing about Charleston and the Black Bottom - She opens the fridge, grabbing a soda.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna start my homework. He watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's good sweetie, think Harvard in three years!

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (laughs ) We'll see.  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra sits on her bed, music playing in her ears. Her book are laid out on the bed around her, but she isn’t studyin She’s looking at the PRINTOUT she took home from the libr The printout of the MISSING PERSON’S REPORT:

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You were special. Like me... She holds onto the picture, laying down on her back. Gett comfortable. Reaches out, TOUCHING THE PICTURE. And after few moments, closes her eyes... A FLASH: Bradley, TIED UP, on the FLOOR OF A VEHICLE -- Abra OPENS her eyes. Startled. Wasn’t expecting that. She looks down at the picture again, and brings her fingers b to the image. Touches it. Closes her eyes again -- FLASHES OF: CORN FIELDS, rolling by. The RUMBLING of the beneath her -- A BASEBALL GLOVE ON THE FLOOR OF THE VAN - She opens her eyes. Takes a deep breath. Lays completely back, holding the picture, squeezing her eyes closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIRDS’ EYE VIEW of the abandoned plant. The LINE OF VEHICLES moving through the dark, NO HEADLIGHTS. RV's, CAMPERS, A VAN... Pulling past the sign: NO TRESPASSING BY ORDER OF THE CAN COUNTY SHERIFF’S DEPT. ANOTHER SIGN BEYOND IT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra CONVULSES SLIGHTLY on the bed, eyes rolled over whit SHE GRIPS A PEN, scribbling on the printout without looki “ORGANIC INDUSTRIES. ETHANOL PLANT #4. CLOSED UNTIL --  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- FURTHER NOTICE,” reads the sign that Abra is transcrib The images come in a FLURRY NOW: BRADLEY SCREAMING -- DIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra GASPS in a breath as her eyes go back to normal. She stands, shaking it off. Tears in her eyes. She heads to the window, looking out at her street, and t MOUNTAINS in the distance. And we can tell... SHE’S ANGRY She GRIPS the window, knuckles turning white. And as she stares at her street, her eyes ROLL BACK AGAIN -- And the room PIVOTS. ROLLING UPWARD, as though the whole house is ROTATING TOWARD THE SKY --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA HOLDS ONTO THE WINDOW AS THE ROOM ROLLS AROUND HER,
dialogues.text: falling back behind her like she’s hanging from the ceili When she opens her eyes, she’s not home anymore. She’s in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a supermarket. Just a normal supermarket. Lit by fluorescent lights, SHOPPERS milling about. Abra is FLOAT FORWARD down an aisle, and she looks down to see -- HANDS, HOLDING A SHOPPING CART. Not her own hands, though the hands of a WOMAN. Reveal ROSE, pushing the cart, loaded with basics. As she goes, she SLOWS down. A strange look on her face. She loo around, trying to shake the odd feeling she has. She starts pushing the cart again. Turning a corner, look out at the ICE CREAM in the freezer. She reaches up, as though to open the freezer doors -- But RESTS HER HANDS on them. EXACTLY THE SAME WAY ABRA WA HOLDING HER WINDOW. Rose CLOSES HER EYES, and sees a FLAS OF ABRA’S STREET, WITH THE MOUNTAINS BEYOND.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Well hi there. In the reflection of the glass freezer doors, Rose can AL SEE ABRA'S FACE, looking back at her. Rose reaches up and back to TOUCH THE BACK OF HER HEAD.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra STARES out her window, eyes rolled over white, when

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose is KNOCKED BACKWARD as the glass of the freezer door SHATTERS BEFORE HER, bottles and containers EXPLODING wit She hits the ground, SHOCKED. BLOOD RUNNING FROM HER NOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra backs away from the window, eyes wide with fear and defiance. Breathing heavy, she SHUTS HER EYES AND SHOUTS

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT OF MY HEAD
dialogues.text: RUMBLE - the whole room SHAKES ON ITS FOUNDATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David LOOKS UP as the house VIOLENTLY SHAKES, the light a him SWINGING as though from a powerful EARTHQUAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose TAKES ANOTHER BLAST, KICKING at the shopping cart as SKIDS across the floor. Sits up, looking wildly around as CLERK rushes to her, to help her to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Ma’‘am... you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I’m fine... Jesus. Jesus. She WIPES the blood from her nose, STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
