dialogues.text: Dan lays on the ground in front of the coffee pot. BLOOD RUNNING FROM HIS NOSE as well. Unconscious. Billy helps l him up as Dan looks around, disoriented.  58.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You okay, Danno?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... what happened?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You just dropped. I thought you was having a stroke... Dan gets to his feet. Wipes the blood from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who’s Tony? Dan looks at him. Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You kept saying “Please Tony, help.”

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose steps out of her truck, heading toward the camp. The others mill about, but Crow can tell right away something wrong. THE BLOOD, on her face and her shirt.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Rosie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door, pulling off her bloody shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We've got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: The looker? She found me again. I’m minding my own business, buyin’ groceries, and there she was.  59.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: (beat) How?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Don’t know, don’t care. We have to have her, Crow, we have to.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Does she... does she know who you are? Where we are?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t think so, but that’s not the important... I said she was huge steam, right? Well it’s even bigger than that. I tried to turn around on her and she blew me out of her like I was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Never happened to me. Never. I would have said it was impossible. Crow takes this in. Rose smiles at him... she’s excited.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Is she food, or do we turn her?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We don’t turn her.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: You sure? If she’s what you say --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Then we don’t want anyone with that kind of power in the Knot. Think about it. (beat) What if it’s neither.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I mean we don’t kill her, we don’t turn her. Think of a cow. You butcher one, gives you meat for months. Keep it alive, take care of it, it gives you milk for years. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And she can take it, Crow. She’1l last a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: We've never tried that.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Because a steam-head’s dangerous. You keep it alive, it could be dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I know. The point... the point is she’s a great, white whale. And I want her, Crow. I want her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra gets out of her mother’s car, backpack over her shoulder. She heads toward the school.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Have a good day, sweetheart!

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Thanks mom! She watches her mom drive away... and once she knows she’ gone, she starts walking AWAY FROM THE SCHOOL, up the str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra approaches the ticket counter at the bus station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra steps off the bus. Looking around the main street of Frazier... closing her eyes. FEELING FOR SOMETHING. She walks, head down. Listening to her music. And then sees something that strikes a chord with her... TEENEYTOWN.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sits at the controls, STARTING THE SMALL TRAIN. Aboar dozens of HAPPY KIDS enjoy the train ride. He sits back, content. Smiling at them. And then... his SMILE FADES. SENSING SOMETHING. He turns around... seeing ABRA, standing a few feet away. SMILING AT HIM. He nods, turning back to the train... but looks back, and she’s still smiling. And then, a VOICE IN HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi. Dan goes PALE. Looks around... how did she find him?

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not here. Gimme a sec. Abra nods. Dan heads to Billy.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, you okay if I take lunch early? Not feeling so hot.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sure. He watches as Dan walks away, through Teeneytown. Some teenager following him, at a bit of a distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Abra sit on the bench outside the public library. Abra watches him, EAGER. EXCITED.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You can hear me --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (out loud) Let's use our outside voices, ok? You tracked me down.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: It was easier than I thought! Like GPS, but in my head --  62.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Listen, and I don’t mean any offense, but this day and age, a man sitting alone with a teenage girl on a bench --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m Abra Rafaella Stone. And you’re my uncle. Uncle Dan. And that’s not even a lie, not totally. In science last year, Mr. Staley told us that all humans share the same genetic plan. He said that the things that make us different are very small things. Did you know that we share something like ninety-nine percent of our genetic makeup with dogs? So you could be my Uncle. Or cousin, or whatever. That’s all I’m saying.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra’s Theory of Relativity.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: We're related in other ways. You're magic, like me. She looks at him, eager. Dan sighs. Reluctant.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Don’t know about magic. I... I always called it the Shining. And yeah, we both Shine. (beat) Do your parents know?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: About my “Shine”? My dad’s always been a little more scared of it, but he thinks it’s gone except for a few things, like me calling from camp because I knew Momo was sick, and he’s glad. My mom’s a little different. Sometimes she’ll ask me to help her find something she’s lost -- last month it was her car keys, she left them on Dad's worktable in the garage -- but she doesn’t know how much is still there. They don’t talk about it. I know it scares them so I try not to. Because if people find out... Eek, a freak. You know? (off his face) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sure you know. You try not to use it, don't you. (realizing) You've been trying a long time.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, I didn’t understand the Shining, so I called it Tony... I thought he was my imaginary friend.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I thought you were my imaginary friend. For a long time. (beat) How many of us are out there?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Lot of folks have a little bit of Shine to them. They don’t even know it. But they always seem to show up with flowers when their wives are sad, they do good on school tests they don’t even study for, they sense how people are feeling as soon as they walk into a room. But I’ve only met two or three people in my life that knew they Shined.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: The baseball boy Shined. His name was Bradley Trevor. She reaches into her bag, handing Dan the printout. Pictu of Bradley Trevor, and OTHER MISSING KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These people - they look like people, anyway - they took him and they... ate him. They ate his Shine.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You could feel it.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: And they could feel me. I think. At least one of them, a lady. A lady with a hat.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: So what do you want to do?  64.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I want to find them. Stop them. Because I think they’ve done this to a lot of other kids, too. (beat) I used to feel so alone. I thought it was only me. You know how that feels, don’t you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: But we’re not alone. And those other kids out there, they’re not alone either but they think they are, and they’re in danger. So I have to do something. Right?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why did you come here? Why me?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (beat) Because you can hear me. You’d believe me. You Shine too. And they hurt people like us. I mean what would you do? Dan shakes his head. This is too much...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you could get something of his, if you could go to Iowa -

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Whoa, hang on.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I can help you find him! Then his parents would know where he was, they can bury him right, at least, but we could also get his glove. If I could touch that glove, I could track them --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Easy --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Because Barry the Chunk, I think that was his name, for a while, before they killed him, he was wearing it.  65. Dan hands her the papers back. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Go home, Abra. Go home, think about school and your parents and the rest of your life. Don’t chase these people, don’t aggravate them, and whatever you do, don’t attract their attention. Don’t Shine. Find something - anything - well, almost anything - to stop that Shine of yours. You keep your head down, keep your Shine dull, and you hope to god that these people - or anything else like them - doesn’t see you. Once they see you, they come back. Do you hear me? They come back. (beat) Keep your head down, and keep yourself safe. Above all else. He stands, leaving her on the bench as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sits at the station, rooms dark around him. He smiles Azzie HOPS up onto the counter, meowing at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey Azzie. The cat hops down, running to an OPEN DOOR. MEOWING.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow, got your wires crossed tonight. No one’s in there, Az. The cat MEOWS louder, heading inside. Dan follows.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you, that room’s empty -- As he turns the corner, he sees SOMEONE STANDING IN THE D ROOM. LOOKING OUT THE WINDOW. Dan takes a step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan steps toward the figure, as he does he CLOSES HIS EYE

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Whoa, hang on, Doc. It’s DICK HALLORANN, barely visible in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Dick... I’m sorry, I thought...

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Thought I was from the Overlook. Almost locked me up. Still getting visits from them old ghosts?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It’s been years. Horace Derwent was the last one. Confetti on his suit. Said “great party, isn’t it?” shit-— eating grin on his face... ‘til I pulled out a box for him. That grin went fast. (beat) You know it never occurred to me to ask, those years ago... what happens to them in these boxes? Do they die in there?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Do you care?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) I’ve missed you.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Has it been a long time? Can’t tell. This world is a dream of a dream to me now.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Eight years. Little more.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Last time I saw you, you was at the bottom. You look better now.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: I’m here because it all comes ‘round. Ka’s a wheel, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra.  67.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: You listen, son, it hurts to be here so I'll only say it once. If these empty devils ever found you, when you was a tyke - if they’d even sniffed you - you'd be long dead. They’re on the land like a cancer on the skin. Once, they rode camels in the desert; once they drove caravans ‘cross Eastern Europe. They eat screams and drink pain and they've noticed that little girl. Dick approaches. Eyes grave.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They might kill her. Might turn her. Or might keep her til she’s all used up and that’d be worst of all. You can’t let ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Because she found you. Because she showed up. Hell doc, why me? You just walked on into my kitchen one day, and I’m still on the hook. Some things just are.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What the hell am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Get her what she asked for. Dick turns back, heading back toward the window. Looking at the mountains in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You won’t see me again, Doc. This is my last dream. It seems to me you grew up fine, son. But you still owe a debt. (beat) Pay it. And then the room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sits in her camper. Eyes closed. Perfectly still whe there is a KNOCK AT HER DOOR. She ignores it. Another kno

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Goddammit, what! The door opens. Crow leans inside.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to interrupt you -

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I told you, no distractions! Nothing to eat, nothing to drink, just peace, quiet and meditation, I need all my wits for her tonight -

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: That’s why I’m here. Found something. He approaches, holding out a newspaper clipping. Rose tak it from him: “POCKET EARTHQUAKE” REPORTED IN ANNISTON.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (reading) “How small can an earthquake be? Pretty small, if the people of Richland Court, a short Anniston street that dead-ends at the Saco River, are to be believed. Late Tuesday night, several residents of the street reported a tremor that rattled windows, shook floors, and sent glassware tumbling from shelves. Although the Geological Survey Center in Wrentham reports there were no temblors in New England last Tuesday” - well I’11l be. Maybe, just maybe...

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I think maybe. Not 100%, but I’1l take 50/50.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: If it’s actually her -  69.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Richland Court -

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: - and she did that, shook a whole street in New Hampshire -

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Having a place to focus on — not just a town but a street — will make things a hell of a lot easier for me tonight. Good catch.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: How you comin’ at her?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: She'll be asleep. I just want to look around. See who she is. Pick up information, plant suggestions like worms. Let ‘em burrow. A hundred worms, about her dear friends the Knot. And when we roll up she’ll be so glad to see us she'll hop right in the van.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: If she did that... if she really shook the whole street, you should be careful.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (beat) I should be careful. She’s a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: And you're the queen bitch of all time, I know. I’m just sayin’. He turns, leaving her to meditate.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ABRA’S HOUSE, ABRA’S ROOM - NIGHT Abra sits on her bed, downtrodden. Headphones in her ears There’s a KNOCK at her door, and Lucy leans in.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Hey mom.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Are you okay? We missed you at dinner.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m okay. Just a rough day.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Wanna talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m good. Lucy nods. Knows better than to push her.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I'm flying out to see Momo in the morning, I‘’1ll be back as soon as I can... (hesitates) Abra?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Is she... gonna pull through this time? Is she gonna be okay? Abra looks at her mother sadly.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I don’t know, mom. I hope so. Tell her I love her. Lucy nods, and closes the door behind her. Abra sighs, tu off the light, and then lays down. Closes her eyes, ready sleep. And dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sits atop her RV. Legs crossed in front of her, sitt lotus. Hands resting gently on her knees, centering herse Getting ready. Above her, a sky full of stars. She takes a deep breath. Concentrates...  71. She briefly OPENS HER EYES, and we realize she is FLOATIN FAR ABOVE THE GROUND. Stars above her, LIGHTS BELOW HER.. the scattered lights of small towns, houses. Cars. ROSE IS TRAVELING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A normal cul-de-sac, quiet. The lights out. Rose STANDS b the street sign: RICHLAND COURT. As she steps forward, to the houses --

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET REVOLVES, AS IF FOLDING TOWARD HER. FOLDING IN
dialogues.text: HALF, so that she is looking straight ahead at THE ROOFTO OF THE HOUSES. Staring at each one... NOTICING BLUE LIGHT coming from one house. AS IF IT IS GLOWING SOFTLY. Rose moves toward the roof, and again the

dialogues.speaker: WORLD TURNS, REVOLVING --
dialogues.text: The house AND THE GROUND BENEATH IT now UPSIDE DOWN as Ro walks, stars beneath her feet -- TOWARD ONE BEDROOM WINDO She holds her hands up, pressing against the glass. Peeri inside... it is ABRA’S ROOM. DARK, save a BLUE GLOW from within... Rose CLOSES HER EYES, concentrating further -- PUSHING THE WINDOW FORWARD, the house TIPPING FORWARD AGA so that she is on top of the window, PUSHING DOWN ON IT l she’s doing a push-up -— And then it FALLS AWAY, the glass DROPPING FROM THE WINDO

dialogues.speaker: DOWN INTO THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The house REVOLVES AGAIN, Rose STEPPING FORWARD through t open window as if it is a small door, and standing now, i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Abra’s room. The room is dark, but above her THE CEILI IS FULL OF STARS. Rose looks at the girl SLEEPING IN THE She can’t see her face, it’s buried in the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Keep sleeping, princess. She steps quietly, looking at the WALLS of the room... an realize the walls aren’t walls at all. They’re FILE DRAWE MEMORIES. Some labeled: “Mom.” “Dad.” “Dreams.” “School.”  72.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You rubes. Spend your whole lives making little boxes, little memories, and you think they make you so rich... you should see mine, kiddo. My mind’s a cathedral. She runs her hands over the file drawers that make up the walls, looking for something interesting. She sees one, decorated in a child’s handwriting...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well hi there. The drawer, larger than the others, is labeled “ME.” Rose GLANCES BACK at the bed, where Abra’s still sleeping She smiles. She reaches up, pulling open the drawer. It EXTENDS FROM THE WALL, coming out about a foot. Rose peer inside, at the FILE FOLDERS packing the drawer... She reaches her hand inside to pull one out.

dialogues.speaker: SPOTLIGHT SHINES DOWN RIGHT IN HER EYES
dialogues.text: SHUT ON ROSE’S HAND - CRUSHING BONES, SNAPPING FINGERS - Rose SCREAMS in SHOCK and surprise. YANKING AT HER HAND, it is CAUGHT, like in a BEAR TRAP. She turns, realizing t ABRA IS SITTING UP... BUT ABRA IS DIFFERENT. Her hair is SHOCK BLONDE, and she NO EYES. No identifying features... LIKE HER FACE HAS BEE CENSORED. The only thing we recognize of Abra IS HER SMIL

dialogues.speaker: DREAM ABRA
dialogues.text: He said you’d come back, and you did... THE SMILE BECOMES A GRIN.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. She STANDS from the bed, moving toward Rose. Rose FLAILS, hand trapped, VULNERABLE AND STUNNED --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Get back -- GET BACK!! But “Abra” just GRINS at her. Advancing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a fucking child!  73. “Abra's” grin FALTERS for just a moment, but she REACHES HER HAND HEADING FOR ROSE’S HEAD --

dialogues.speaker: AND ROSE IS SUDDENLY ALONE IN THE ROOM.
dialogues.text: ALL OF THE FURNITURE IS GONE, a strange SLUDGE on the gro oozing up around her and HOLDING HER ON THE SPOT. A TRAP Suddenly, Rose is aware of a NOISE. Like PAPERS being rif through, very fast --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you... (realizes) NO. She CLOSES her eyes, and for just a FLASH we see -- -- a CAVERNOUS SPACE, vast and dark, FULL OF FILE CABINET DRAWERS -- ROSE’S MEMORIES, ROSE’S MIND -- AND A YOUNG GI Is RIFLING THROUGH THEM -- -- Rose OPENS HER EYES, thrashing her head back and forth

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT
dialogues.text: The sounds of PAPERS is deafening as Abra DIGS through Ro mind. Desperate, Rose begins to TEAR HER HAND out of the drawer that holds it. Her fingers SNAP, the skin PEELS BA But she RIPS HER HAND from the vice, and STUMBLES toward window, holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT
dialogues.text: The room ROTATES AGAIN, the window DROPPING DOWN, and Ros stumbles, FALLING THROUGH THE OPENING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- into the night, the world TURNING again, Rose FREE FAL TOWARD THE SKY, out of control -- THE WORLD TURNING BENEATH HER, AS THOUGH SHE’S SUDDENLY A 35,000 FEET, the wind KNOCKING HER BACK AND FORTH, as the ground suddenly RUSHES UP TOWARD HER -- She PLUMMETS, down toward an RV parked in a campsite --  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- AND BACK INTO HER OWN BODY, laying flat on her back on of her camper -- as the world ROTATES VIOLENTLY TO THE SI sending her ROLLING toward the edge of the camper -- AND FALLING HARD ONTO THE GROUND BESIDE IT. She GASPS, lifting her face from the DIRT. BLOOD running from her no eyes wide. Crow RUSHES TOWARD HER, followed by Andi and several other members of the True Knot.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Rose!

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (gasping) Trap... She tries to stand up, putting weight on her hand -- And HOWLS with pain. She slumps down, pulling her hand up her face to look at the damage -- BROKEN FINGERS. NAILS PULLED OUT. DEEP GASHES in her skin -- it’s like her hand put through a SHREDDER.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?!

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (gasping) Little bitch set a trap for me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Your hand -- Rose SHOVES HER BACK. Furious. She SCREAMS into the night

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Rose -- She SPINS toward him, and we see -- HER EYES ARE DIFFEREN INHUMAN. Small POINTS OF LIGHT SHINE from her PUPILS, subtle... but her feigned humanity is SLIPPING in her ang

dialogues.speaker: CROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Calm down. We know where she is now, right? Now we know.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: She was in my head.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: (blinks) What?  75.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Stealing! Stealing from me!

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: What does she know?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: How much did she see?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I don’t know! She fumes. Paces. Clutching her damaged hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's dead. That little thing dared... fuck... with me... BARRY interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: There’s a problem -

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Not now!

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Grampa Flick. They turn and look at him.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think he’s cycling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan STIRS in his sleep, a VOICE IN HIS HEAD -- CRACKING, the FREQUENCY IS OFF, but BREAKING THROUGH --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Uncle Dan! Uncle Dan! I hurt her, I really hurt her! He WINCES, sitting up. Disoriented.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra SITS in bed, in the dark. Eyes closed. SENDING HER THOUGHTS. Whispering to herself...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (whispering) I hurt her and she deserved it and that’s not the best part -- INT. DAN’S ROOM, ELLIOT STREET - CONTINUOUS Dan holds his temples as he listens to her voice in his h distorted but clearly hers.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- the best part is I got in her head. I got in her head. Uncle Dan? Are you there? Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to himself) Oh god, Abra. What did you do... Dan stands, heading toward the wall. The word MURDER, cra into the plaster. He picks up a piece of chalk, and after beat... writes “OKAY. WHERE?” And he STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) Just talk to the kid. If we’re gonna do this, let’s do this. He PUTS THE CHALK DOWN. Takes a beat... and closes his ey

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi Abra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her bed, Abra suddenly LIGHTS UP. Dan’s voice FILLING HEAD, no distortion at all. Like he’s RIGHT THERE.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I can hear you...

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I sent you away, before. Tell me everything. Then tell me what I’ve got to do in Iowa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The members of the True Knot gather around the campfire. They've pulled GRAMPA FLICK out into a field, near the firelight. They stare at him, faces pale and afraid. He lays on the ground, COUGHING. FRAIL. He appears near death. Crow crouches beside him. Rose is CRYING. Andi sta beside her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You will.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: I thought we lived forever...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Did someone promise you that, Andi? Someone say you’re immortal? I said “live long, eat well.” We can live long, very long, and we do, most of us, but we haven’t been eating well, not for a long time now and Grampa... Rose looks down at the pale man by the firelight.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He turned me, you know. A long, long time ago. Crow approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: He’s going. They step over Grampa Flick. As Andi watches, we realize something has been happening - HIS SKIN IS FLICKERING. “CYCLING” between being visible, normal skin, and being TRANSPARENT. We have FLASHES of his skeleton within... We can see his LIVER, HIS LUNGS, HIS VEINS AND ARTERIES. NERVES CONNECTING HIS EYES TO HIS BRAIN -- And then, he’s BACK, and those eyes fix on Rose.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA FLICK
dialogues.text: Rosie...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Yes, love.  78. She crouches to him. Holds his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA FLICK
dialogues.text: I’m scared...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (defiant) No. No you’re not. Not you, my love. You watched empires rise and fall, cheered the gladiators in Rome. You sailed across oceans to new worlds and you fed on Kings, princes, and popes. They wrote myths of you and made statues and they trembled in their villages and beds and skyscrapers and they screamed, screamed at your coming. They broke against you like waves on rocks and they died by the billions as you burned like a sun, for eons. EONS. So no. You are not scared. Not you. You are a god, and you eat fear. You are not afraid. He smiles. Tears fall down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at us. Look at the family you made. We are your legacy, love, and we are legion. As he looks at them -- the CYCLING BEGINS AGAIN. Violent time. He SCREAMS as his body CONTORTS, FLASHING transpare then back, then INTO SOMETHING ELSE --

dialogues.speaker: VERSIONS OF HIMSELF, SCREAMING IN AGONY UNTIL --
dialogues.text: HE BURSTS APART. Not an explosion... just as though he ha ATOMIZED. His physical body CONVERTING... TO STEAM. And, TEARS in their eyes, his “family” steps forward -- A BEGINS BREATHING HIM IN. FEASTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan knocks at the door. Again. And again. After a few moments... Billy answers.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: It’s four in the morning --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You've always seen me, Billy. Got a sense about people, that fair to say? You think I’m an honest man? A good man? Billy stares at him. Confused.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I do, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I need your help. And the first thing I need is for you to listen to a story and try - harder than you've ever tried - to believe me. INT. DAN’S CAR - SUNRISE Dan drives down the highway. He looks over at the passeng seat, where BILLY IS SLEEPING. The vast countryside, the coming up. A voice from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How’s it going? Dan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be getting ready for school? The camera pivots -- revealing ABRA, in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Yeah but I wanted to tag along. How long have you been driving?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Few hours so far. We should be there tonight. Late.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Who's that?  80. Dan looks over at Billy, sleeping soundly.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: A friend. Maybe my best friend. (beat) Any more visitors?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: No. And I’ve tried to find her again, but she put up a firewall.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Well when we get the glove, we’ll know where they are. And we need to, more than ever. Now that she’s really onto you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra sits in her bed, headphones on. Concentrating. She smiles, leaning back.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You should have seen her face. She was scared, Uncle Dan. INT. DAN'S CAR -— CONTINUOUS Abra smiles at him. She is ENJOYING THIS.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Scared like those kids were scared. All those kids she’s killed... she was so mad, and so scared, that I got inside. (beat) That was a new trick. I’ve never done that before.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I haven’t either. What was it like?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Like a library. I guess we’re all libraries, inside. It looked like a cathedral of file cabinets, but only because that’s how she thought of them. If she was thinking of a museum, or a computer, I would have seen that, I think.  81.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Like this, just a little push -- Dan JOLTS, the car wheel SPINNING a little in his hand. F moment, a FLASH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the LIBRARY of the OVERLOOK. A TYPEWRITER on a desk. F cabinets, many, from the floor to the ceiling... Then a f into DARKNESS --

dialogues.speaker: DOZENS OF THEM. LIKE COFFINS...
dialogues.text: Abra STEPS toward the lock boxes, each the size of a PERS The LIDS BUMPING, SCRATCHING. THINGS TRYING TO GET OUT --

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Abra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra LANDS on the floor of her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Sorry! Sorry... Her door opens, and David pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry, rolled out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You feeling any better?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m okay dad. Sorry about that. He leaves. Abra stands up, getting back onto her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan shakes his head, laughing a little, glancing at Billy STILL ASLEEP. Abra appears in the back seat again.  82.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I wasn’t trying to --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You're strong. I mean it... you just pushed me right out. Like it was nothing. (beat) What were those boxes?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Liar.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (long beat) When I was a kid... younger than you... I bumped into something like these things. Something that ate, like they do. Only it wasn’t a person... it was a place. (beat) They closed it down, after. Let it rot. But some of the things that lived there, they... don’t poke around in there again.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I won’t. I promise. (beat) Thank you. For helping me.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Don’t thank me yet, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sits at the edge of the woods, looking out in the tr Behind her, Crow approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: We’re almost ready. Loading up.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Good. Get the caravan on the road, we'll have her in a day or two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t think you should come.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (beat) The fuck did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: She tagged you. She got in your head --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Won’t happen again. I underestimated her a bit but it won't happen again --

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: She knows you. And who knows how much she got to before you kicked her out.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: She’s mine, Crow.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: She is. But right now, far as we know, you’re the only one of us she could track. She sees you coming, she could run. Or set another trap. Better you hang back. He steps toward her, putting his hands on her

dialogues.speaker: CROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’1l knock her out cold. One of our assets in the NSA gave me the good stuff, put her out without a chance of overdose. I’m gonna head South, circle around, come at her froma different direction --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I should be there.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: I'll sniff her out, like I always do. Track her right to the door, like I always do. Deliver her right to your feet, like always. All yours. But if she sees you coming it puts us all in danger and you know that, Rosie, you know I’m right about this. 83. arms.  84. Rose nods. He’s right.

dialogues.speaker: CROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1l leave Andi with you, if you want --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No. You’ll need your strength, all of you, if she pulls a trick on you. You stay together.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: I got some tricks of my own. He kisses her. Smiles. And turns, heading back toward the vans. Rose watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy’s driving now. Dan sits beside him, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I think we're here. Dan sits up. There’s nothing but CORN FIELDS all around.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay, let me see if I can get her. (beat) Abra... And long beat. And then, she’s in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: That's the sign. She points. Dan follows. There, in the headlights: ORGANI

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pull around back --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Pull around back --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: And I’1l tell you when to stop --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She’1l tell us when to stop.  85. Billy looks over at him. Worried.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you, Danno. I don’t know whether I hope you’re right or wrong about this. I mean if you’re wrong, it means my friend is crazy. I mean full-blown-mental-breakdown- monsters-killing-imaginary-kids bonkers, but I can work with that. If you're right though...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know. It’s much worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy and Dan stand in a familiar spot. FRESH DIRT. Darke now, with only the one set of headlights. The plant loomi above them. Dan pulls the SHOVELS out of the back of the

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You should go home.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What? You said you needed my help -

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not you. PULL BACK TO REVEAL: Abra, standing with them.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Oh... you’re talking to her? She’s here now?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No. We'll take it from here. Abra hangs back, reluctant. Finally, she is gone.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Just us. Billy looks at him, scared, as Dan starts DIGGING. And digging. Some time passes...

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You smell that?  86. Billy keeps digging. Face pale.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Used to hunt. Did I ever tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Deer. This one summer, I clipped this buck, had been tracking him two days, and I got the shot and I clipped him. He ran off. I went after, figured he wasn’t gonna last long but he vanished, just up and evaporated. Not a trace. Truly baffling. Dan and Billy keep digging.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Five days later, I’m trying a different spot. Miles away. Miles. And I come round, looking for a spot for the blind, and I smelled him... smelled him. Found that buck, huddled up to a hollow trunk. Dead for days. The smell, the look of him -- never hunted a day since. (beat) This’s the same smell. They dig more. Dirt piles a little higher. And then...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Billy. Billy looks over. There, barely revealed in the dirt... i the LEATHER OF A SHOE. Sticking out. They lock eyes, and gently drop to their knees. Digging higher with their gloved hands... HOLDING THEIR BREATH, GASPING for air when they can. And finally they stand bac Protruding from the dirt, is the SCREAMING, ROTTING FACE Bradley Trevor. STILL LOCKED IN HORROR, bugs and worms ha their day. The BASEBALL GLOVE, clutched in his hands. Dan leans forward, CRYING NOW. He reaches out, GENTLY SLI THE BASEBALL GLOVE through the white, broken fingers.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus wept.  87. Billy STUMBLES out of the shallow grave, VOMITING onto th ground. Dan follows, looking sadly down.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Fuck... fuck, Danno. How the fuck... they didn’t even bury him deep. They buried him shallow.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What did you get us into -- He puts his hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do we do now --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We cover him back up. Call the police from a payphone, on the way out of town. Let his parents have him, at least. And we get this glove to the girl who needs it. INT. DAN'S CAR —- MORNING Dan drives, Billy sits in the passenger seat. Shell shock Looking out at the sun over the empty fields.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: The people who did that...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They aren’t people.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No. No they aren’t. Anyone who would do that to a little boy... they’re not people. (beat) But they’re coming.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Billy nods. Processing.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you get it? Dan sighs. Abra is in the back seat.  88.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we got it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: She's back?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We're heading to you. We’1ll be there in the morning, we have a stop to make. Abra... I need you to show your parents what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: No! They just -- they almost think I’m normal! If I tell them -

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rose’1ll go through them to get to you. You know that, don’t you? She'll cut them down without a second thought and she is coming, Abra. They need to know. Abra GLARES at him. Tears in her eyes. And then... she’s gone. Dan sighs. Looks over at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What stop do we have to make?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Do you still have that old deer rifle? Billy looks at him. The color draining from his face.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ABRA’S HOUSE - THE NEXT MORNING Dan pulls into the driveway. He’s CLEANED UP, the dirt al gone. Billy is with him. As Dan steps out of the car -- DAVID bursts through the front door. Abra TUGGING at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (furious) You're “Uncle Dan?”  89.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The fuck do you think you are --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sir --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She is thirteen years old --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to Abra) I told you to show him --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I told him!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm kicking your ass before I call the police -- David GRABS Dan, SPINNING him around, SHOVING HIM ONTO TH CAR. Billy RUSHES FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Hey -- Dan HOLDS UP HIS HAND, waving Billy back.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Don’t say her name you sick son of a bitch --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra! David WRAPS HIS ELBOW around Dan’s neck, HURLING HIM DOWN ready to POUND HIS FACE -- David suddenly SCREAMS as a LOUD NOISE fills his head. Li an AIR HORN, CRUSHING HIS EARS. He STUMBLES BACK, hands t his ears. Billy watches... HE CAN’T HEAR ANYTHING. Finally the noise STOPS, and another noise fills his head  90.

dialogues.speaker: DAD.
dialogues.text: David STUMBLES, his hands coming up to his head. Abra’s v LOUD inside his mind. He spins back to her, STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: STOP.
dialogues.text: Dan gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Mister Stone. I'ma friend. And everything she told you is true.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The hell... is happening...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra needs to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit at the table. David shakes his head. Still angry but mostly CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I saw him. I saw the body, it’s true.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Probably your friend here put him there. You think about that?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Not for long, I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Your daughter is special, Mr. Stone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Don’t talk about her --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: And you know that. Deep down. David doesn’t answer.  91.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She saw what happened to that little boy, and she saw who did it. (turning to Abra) Show him. Abra walks toward David. Reaches up, touching his head.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Daddy. I really didn’t want to...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Didn’t want to what -- She closes her eyes. And suddenly -- FLASHES. THE ETHANOL PLANT. BRADLEY’S SCREAMING FACE. ROS LEANING OVER HIM... Dan and Billy watch sadly as David CONVULSES in the chair the images playing through his head. A look of BEWILDERED HORROR ON HIS FACE. Tears fall as he relives Bradley’s final moments... and t he SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHAKING HAND pours a glass of whiskey. We follow it up David's pale face, still processing what he just saw. Dow the drink in a single gulp. He turns to Dan and Billy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Drink? They each manage a very small, sad smile. Waving him away

dialogues.speaker: DAN AND BILLY
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Those... people. They know about my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They do. And sooner or later, they’re coming.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We've gotta do something. Call the police, the FBI --  92.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They've been doing this a long, long time sir. They are ancient, rich, and connected. I don’t think they're very worried about police.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well where are they? When are they coming? Where can we go --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra can answer that. If she’s ready. Abra sits at the table. Steeling herself.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m ready. Dan reaches into his bag, and slowly - reverently - remov the BASEBALL GLOVE. She stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Are you sure you want to do this? I'm asking all of you. This is dangerous. I mean truly, truly dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I have to. They already know me. They're already on their way. And they can’t keep doing this, Uncle Dan. We can’t let them. He moves toward her. Holding it out. Abra takes a breath. and TAKES THE GLOVE. CLOSING HER EYES. We hold on her. Hearing the gentle sounds of a HIGHWAY fa up. And when she opens her eyes, she’s in -- INT. CROW’S RV - DAY -- Crow’s RV. STARING AT BARRY’S HAND... the same hand th wore the glove. HER TRACKING POINT. She looks up from Barry, who is asleep in his chair. Look toward the driver’s seat -- WHERE CROW IS DRIVING. She tu back, toward the back of the RV, looking out the window - AT ANOTHER VEHICLE. SNAKEBITE ANDI IS DRIVING. There’s a small CARAVAN on the move...  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra OPENS HER EYES.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I-95. Barry, the Crow, the Snake and a few others. They’re close. Very close. The trees haven’t changed that much, maybe Massachusetts but they’re close.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rose?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Didn't see her. But they’re coming. (beat) I don’t want them anywhere near my dad. Nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: If you think I’m leaving you --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan steps into Abra’s bedroom, followed by Abra, David an Billy. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: This is the only room she saw?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: That’s right. And I made some changes. Hid some things.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay... they’1l be trying to track you. Trying to catch on. His eyes go to the STUFFED BUNNY by her bed. The same one carried when she was a little girl. Dan stares. AN IDEA.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you're going to let them.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Probably. But you’re going to let them, and then I need you to try to do a little trick.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (smiling) A magic trick?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: More like ventriloquism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan drives. Beside him, Abra sits in the passenger seat. Billy is in the back. No sign of David.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (eyes closed) They're following us.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Good. Let them. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Concentrate. You've gotta keep it up until they land.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan’s car drives into the STATE PARK entrance. Passing CAMPGROUNDS... heading deeper into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose steps out of her camper. Looks around the nearly deserted campsite, sighing. She CLIMBS THE LADDER, gettin onto the roof. Sitting lotus, quieting herself.  95.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Okay, Crow Daddy. Go get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan’s car comes to a stop. He climbs out, looking around. nice, secluded area... no other campers, not just yet. So PICNIC TABLES. Billy gets out behind him, heading to the TRUNK.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: This could work.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Good blinds, over there and there. Dan walks to Abra’s door, opening it. Looking in at her. She's sitting VERY STILL, concentrating hard.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Still close?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Getting closer. I think. This is tough -

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know. Not much longer. Come on. Let’s get you ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RV moves slowly through the park. Purposefully. Down wooded path... and to the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle comes to a stop. The doors open... and Andi, Barry, Silent Sarey and Apron Annie STEP OUT. Trying to l casual. Looking across the field, toward the picnic area WHERE ABRA SITS at the table, eyes closed. Concentrating. Andi points. Barry nods, and they start FANNING OUT. Head toward her.  96. BY THE TREE LINE: Dan and Billy CROUCH. HIDING. Watching through RIFLE SCOPES. THE CROSSHAIRS ON THE GROUP...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (whispering) I don’t know, Dan. Jesus, I don’t know if I can do this -

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know. I know...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I mean, they’re people. I don’t know if I can just...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Look at their hands. He does. He sees -- SYRINGES. In Andi’s hand, and in Barr as they approach Abra. BY THE TABLES: Andi steps closer. Abra is SITTING STILL, CLOSED. CONCENTRATING.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sweetheart. Abra opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look relaxed. You feel relaxed, don’t you Abra.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (beat) I guess.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You should. Just relax. We’re friends.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You're friends.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: That’s right. She steps closer, syringe behind her back.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just friends, and we want to take you to meet more friends. Good friends.  97. She gets closer. Close enough to reach out and touch her. BY THE TREE LINE: Dan’s finger tightens on the trigger. B watches through the scope as Andi LIFTS THE NEEDLE. BY THE TABLES: Andi STICKS THE NEEDLE INTO ABRA’S ARM, depressing the syringe. And laughs to herself.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well shit, the way they talked you up, I was expecting it to be little harder than that... Her smile fades. She STARES... Abra ISN'T THERE. She just stuck a syringe into ABRA’S STUFFED BUNNY. She BLINKS. The spell broken. Looks around wildly. As she turns, her eyes BURN WITH LIGHT. LIKE FLAMES. Billy GASPS when he sees her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They're not people, Billy. Not even close. Andi GLARES at Barry.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: The fuck? Barry and the others CONVERGE, eyes wild.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Parlor tricks. Fucking parlor tricks - BANG. A bullet SPINS HIM AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose suddenly LURCHES FORWARD, GASPING IN PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Get out get out get out of there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn toward the tree line --  98. Where Dan and Billy OPEN FIRE. BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG - The bullets STRIKE APRON ANNIE and SILENT SAREY as they D FOR COVER. Barry PULLS HIS OWN PISTOL, FIRING BACK -— BILLY SHOOTS HIM IN THE HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Holy shit -- Barry’s skin CYCLING, TRANSLUCENT, HIS SCREAMING SKULL

dialogues.speaker: LIKE FORM, FLASHES BRIEFLY --
dialogues.text: And he BURSTS AWAY IN A CLOUD OF STEAM -- BANG BANG - Apron Annie and Silent Sarey SLAM INTO TREES,

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND, BEFORE CYCLING VIOLENTLY AWAY --
dialogues.text: Andi is HIT in the shoulder, SPINNING HER LIKE A TOP. She SCRAMBLES BACK toward the RV, looking up to see -- ABRA, STARING AT HER. GRINNING.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You little shit --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You deserve it. You --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra SITS ON HER KITCHEN TABLE, MEDITATING. GRINNING. Bes her, David watches, NERVOUS.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: -- deserve it. All of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Billy ADVANCE on the RV. FIRING at another True K member, KNOCKING THEM DOWN. They start to CYCLE on the ground. They flank the RV, moving fast. Billy gestures that he’s going around back, and Dan heads the door. Inside, Andi’s FACE pops up by the window, and FIRES -- but he’s OUT OF AMMO.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Neat trick.  99. Dan frantically tries to reload, dropping to one knee. Pulling out some AMMO, loading the gun fast.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s the girl? CLICK. He chambers a round.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got just one question for you sweetie... He brings the gun up, training it on the window. Waiting. Andi’s face APPEARS IN THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aren’t you sleepy? Dan DROPS to one knee. The gun FALLING FROM HIS HAND. He’ suddenly VERY TIRED, trying to WILL HIMSELF TO STAY AWAKE Andi GASPS as he STARTS TO GET BACK UP.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (impressed) You're sleepy. Dan GLARES AT HER. DEFIANT.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sleep. Dan KEEPS FIGHTING. Andi stares at him, NOT SURE WHAT'S HAPPENING. WHY ISN’T THIS WORKING... she steps out of the

dialogues.speaker: ANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sleep. Finally, Dan DROPS. UNCONSCIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra BOLTS UP, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Wake up! Uncle Dan, WAKE UP --

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS.
dialogues.text: Abra’s voice, far away, trying to push through the dark..

dialogues.speaker: WAKE UP
dialogues.text: Dan’s eyes start to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan squints, looking up to Andi, who is standing over him Lifting his gun.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: Fucking men. Fucking men...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (groggy) Child eater. Andi stops. Stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: You rubes slaughter cows, pigs. Chickens. It’s no different. She raises the gun, pointing it at his head --

dialogues.speaker: BANG.
dialogues.text: He opens them. The shot didn’t come from Andi... it came BILLY, who leans against the corner of the RV. PISTOL SMO IN HIS HAND. He got her RIGHT IN THE NECK. Andi DROPS THE RIFLE, hand to her wound. BANG - the secon shot HITS HER CHEST, SPINNING HER. SHE HITS THE GROUND. Billy steps closer as Dan tries to GET TO HIS KNEES.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Fuck... fuck. That’s all of them, Danno. That’s all --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (choking) Stay back - Andi lays on the ground, her skin CYCLING. Her eyes STARI at Billy through her translucent skin, the blood from the BULLET WOUNDS visible spreading through body as she cycle  101. He stares, AWESTRUCK...

dialogues.speaker: ANDI
dialogues.text: (raspy) Kill yourself. Billy BLINKS. Dan BURSTS forward, trying to GRAB THE GUN

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Billy no! No! Billy STRUGGLES AGAINST DAN as Andi LAUGHS, cycling on th ground... and Billy SMASHES the stock of the gun into Dan face, KNOCKING HIM BACK. Billy looks at him, helpless, eyes wide and terrified as

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Noooo -- BILLY FIRES. Dan STARES. Devastated. A SPLASH of blood hitting his face. The sound of Billy’s body hitting the ground, and then...

dialogues.speaker: ANDI FINISHES CYCLING, A BURST OF STEAM DISSIPATING INTO
dialogues.text: AIR. Dan crawls to Billy. TEARS IN HIS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry... I’m so sorry... Billy looks at him, still confused... and then RED STEAM rises from Billy’s mouth and nose. A DEATH RATTLE... and Billy is gone. Dan CRIES, looking around. Helpless. Barely aware of ABRA standing over his shoulder. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: There’s one missing -- there was a van. There was a van. He turns to her, not understanding.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t see the Crow. Where’s the

dialogues.speaker: CROW --
dialogues.text: And she suddenly VANISHES.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra. Abra!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra LOOKS UP, lip quivering. A NEEDLE stuck in her neck, syringe DEPRESSED. CROW smiles at her as she stares at hi

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Hello, Abra. She COLLAPSES, he CATCHES HER. Starts to lift her up...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get away from her. Crow stops. Turns. Chuckles to himself to see DAVID, stan at the kitchen door. A KNIFE in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Step back. Crow gently places Abra down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Sure thing, daddy. You know, I’m glad we got to meet.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Brave words. Always tickles me, watching you rubes threaten a god. You know, your little girl... she’s maybe the best food we’ll ever have. He steps toward David.

dialogues.speaker: CROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so glad I had a chance to compliment the chef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens. Crow carries Abra to the driveway, where his VAN is parked. He leaves the door open behind h and through the doorway we see -- DAVID'S LIFELESS BODY, crumpled on the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan spins around in the field, next to the abandoned RV. Desperate. Tears on his face, blood on his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra! Abra! Abra! Silence. No response. He stands in the field, looking aro The only evidence that anything bad ever happened here... BILLY'S CORPSE, sprawled out by the camper. Broken, alone, Dan heads to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose PACES, tears on her face. RAGE. And finally her PHON RINGS. She looks at it, relieved, rushing it to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Tell me you got her. A beat... and then she RELAXES.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra lays on the back seat. TIED UP with her seatbelt. Sh starts to COME TO, blinking. GROGGY. Looking around with GROWING PANIC.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Oh good, you’re awake. She looks up at him. SQUEEZES HER EYES SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Dan -

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Don’t bother. Abra dry heaves, trying to get her bearings.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with me...  104.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: You are dosed, missy. More than I ever used before. Might let you wake up, here and there, but that steam of yours is fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (realizing) My dad. Crow doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (angry) What happened to my dad.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Lotta good people killed today. Lotta good people. Abra starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: CROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would love to tell you someone will pay, some kind of justice raining down for the sad events today but it don’t work like that. We were always gonna have you. Some of my people are dead, some of yours dead... outcome didn’t change, though. Think on that a minute. Outcome didn’t change, so their deaths... all of them... just a waste. A waste, you brought on us all. For what? Abra closes her eyes. Tries to reach out to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Please... hear me...

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Ain’t no one hearing you, darling. Might as well calm down, enjoy the ride. Like I said. Outcome hasn’t changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan enters the room, a BROWN BAG in his hand. He frantica pulls out its contents... A BOTTLE OF WHISKEY.  105.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh please, please please please. (concentrates) Abra... Abra! Abra! Silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (concentrating) Dick... you there? I need help... I need your help... Dick please... He STARES AT IT. Tears on his cheeks. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t Doc. You don’t need it, you don’t... (quiet) Someone help me. Tony... please help me, Tony. Silence. He leans forward, PICKING UP THE BOTTLE. Holds i his hands. Stares at it. And after a few long, AGONIZING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottle flies out of Dan’s window, SMASHING on the sidewalk below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sits back down. Staring at the wall in front of him, word MURDER cracked into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. He always said your brain was like a radio... He sits lotus, collecting himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one’s answering when you call. So stop calling. (beat) And just listen. Dan concentrates. A haze of noise... and then VOICES. DOZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to sort through them. Concentrating harder than ever has before. BLOOD BEGINS TO RUN FROM HIS NOSE. And finally, there in the mess of noise, a TINY VOICE...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dan... He THROWS HIS ARMS out in front of him as the entire room TIPS FORWARD. He SLIDES ACROSS THE FLOOR, BRACING HIMSELF

dialogues.speaker: AGAINST THE WALL --
dialogues.text: And OPENS HIS EYES. HIS WALL IS GONE. He’s in a VAN. ABRA on the seat in front of him, curled down. CRYING QUIETLY.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hi. She looks. Eyes wide, groggy. Tries to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t talk. He looks past her, to where CROW is driving. Looks at the SEAT BELTS tied around Abra, holding her down.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He drugged you. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Help... He leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to try something. You're weak, and he’s blocking you, I could barely hear you... I need you to trust me. Okay? Okay? She nods. He reaches out his hand, toward hers. She STRETCHES, trying to touch his fingertips with her own...
Crow drives along. Behind him, Abra SITS UP in her seat. Staring right at him. He glances in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Awake again, huh? Might need to dose you at the next rest stop.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: You know where. Abra looks around.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Fuck. I feel... hung over.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Told you. It’s good shit.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Haven't felt hungover in years. And you know I don’t miss it. Not even a little. Crow pauses. Looks at her in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looking out the window) West... staying off the major roads, huh? Smart. She sees a sign. CROWNVILLE, 10 MILES.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crownville. New York. Crow stares. Looks closely. Abra looks back at him in the mirror, but her EYES ARE DIFFERENT. COLDER. ANGRY. AND THEY’RE BROWN. NOT BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: (quietly) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m the guy that killed your friends.  108. Crow freezes. Isn’t sure what to do. Clenches up, like a walking through a mine field.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Well nice to meet you. Neat trick... haven’t seen this one before.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Wanna see one more? Crow slowly REACHES for the gun at his hip.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t imagine Rose’1ll be happy if you shoot the prize. Crow’s hand stops.

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: Don’t suppose Rose is gonna be happy about any of this. And when that woman gets mad... Well, seems to me you know enough to know you might wanna sit this one out. Count your blessings, go on your way. Abra reaches around, checking her SEAT BELT. She LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: CROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s so funny, friend.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Well, it’s just... arrogance. Arrogance, really. But it makes sense. If you think you’re gonna live forever, stands to reason... She grins at him.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course you wouldn’t wear your seat belt. Crow glances down. His belt UNBUCKLED -- Abra THROWS HER HANDS OUT, JERKING THEM TO THE RIGHT -- THE STEERING WHEEL JERKS TO THE RIGHT AS SHE DOES --—  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van SWERVES FROM THE ROAD, through the guard rail,

dialogues.speaker: BARRELING TOWARD THE TREES
dialogues.text: EJECTED through the windshield --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan JERKS AWAKE on his bedroom floor, the momentum of the CRASH sending him FLYING BACKWARD against his bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Rose DROPS TO HER KNEES, SCREAMING IN PAIN AND SHOCK..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is SLAMMED against the trees. Inside, Abra is HEL FAST by her seat belts. She looks around, DISORIENTED...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: (weak) Dan? Dan? She gets out of the car. Walks toward the SMASHED HOOD -- sees CROW, CRUMPLED ON THE GROUND. CYCLING. She crouches down next to him. He stares at her, SHOCKED

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope that hurts. A lot. He CYCLES, contorting one last time into the INHUMAN CREA that resides underneath... And then VANISHES IN A RUSH OF STEAM. Leaving Abra alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan SMILES. Gasping. Wiping the blood from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hang tight, Abra. I’m coming. He grabs his keys, and runs into the night.
Abra WALKS up the street by herself, in the dark. Shaken the crash. As she does, she looks up and sees -—

dialogues.speaker: ROSE. STANDING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROAD, IN THE MOONLIGH
dialogues.text: Abra GASPS -- but then realizes. She can see the MOONLIGH THROUGH ROSE.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Well hi there. Rose glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess there’s no point hiding anymore, is there.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You killed them. You killed him.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: The Crow? I did. And I’m gonna kill you, Rose the Hat. Rose BRISTLES. Smiles at her... but we can see the RAGE behind her eyes. The DISBELIEF.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Big words, dear. Big words from such a small child --

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: A small child that just killed your man.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I’1ll come for you.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I know. I hope so. Because if you don’t, if you chicken out, you coward, and I really need you to hear me when I say this... She steps close.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’1ll come for you. Abra PUSHES HER WAY through Rose, and the projection BURS AWAY like a puff of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose OPENS HER EYES. Fuming.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Alright, bitch-child. Alright. Rose gets up, going to the CANISTERS OF STEAM. THE LAST O THEM. She TEARS THEM OPEN with her hands, GORGING HERSELF THE STEAM that comes from them. Pulling it all in. As we watch, her skin GLIMMERS. Her eyes GLOWING from the pupils... she’s GETTING STRONGER. As the steam courses through her, HER HAND BEGINS TO HEAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan’s car pulls into the parking lot. He gets out, lookin around... and sees ABRA, crouched in the corner of the parking lot. She runs to him, throwing her arms around hi

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DAN’S CAR - AFTERNOON Abra WAKES UP in the passenger seat. Dan is driving. She looks out the window...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I dozed off.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You earned it.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Where are we going? Dan looks at the road. His face pale.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (long beat) Colorado.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Why Colorado?  112.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) She's going to keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Always. This only ends if we end it... and I don’t think we can beat her. Not by ourselves. (beat) There’s a place. It’s a dangerous place, for people like us.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: The place you told me about. The hungry place.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: If it’s so dangerous, why would we go there?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Because if it’s dangerous for people like us... and it is... I expect it’s dangerous for people like her. Maybe even more so. They drive in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Good. She’s following us, you know.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That’s good. Let her. (beat) I’m sorry. About your father. Abra nods. Takes a beat... and STARTS TO CRY.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about your friend. (beat) This won’t end. Not unless we end it. So let’s end it. They drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan’s car blazes down the road. The fields of Iowa extend around them. INT. DAN'S CAR -— CONTINUOUS Abra looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Iowa. Where this started.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Started before that, I’m afraid. Abra’s PHONE RINGS. She looks at it...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Oh no. (beat) It’s my mom. Dan nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Tell her you’re okay. But don’t tell her where we're going... you don’t want Rose within a hundred miles of her.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I know. What do I say to her? Dan reaches out, taking her hand. Abra answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy sits on the curb, surrounded by POLICE. They’re goin through her house. Tears on her face, devastated and shoc

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh thank god -- where are you? Are you okay? As she talks, several DETECTIVES stand beside her, listen  114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra tries to hold it together.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m okay, mom. I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Come home... my god, Abra, what’s happening...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you. Yet. But I’m okay. I’m with a friend, and we’re going to... we’re going to get the people that did this to dad.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Who did this?!

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry mom. I’11 call when I can. (beat) I love you. She hangs up. Looks over at Dan.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When we’re safe, you’ll call her. Tell her where to find us.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Okay. She rolls down the window, and THROWS THE PHONE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra looks up at the IMPOSING MOUNTAINS as Dan finishes gassing up the car. A LIGHT SNOWFALL on the ground around them, more on the mountains above. He climbs back inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not too much further. Up the mountain.  115.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Are we going to win, Uncle Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We have to. They start driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar mountain pass, the camera FLOATING OVERHEAD Dan’s car treks up the snowy mountainside. Higher and hig and further and further away from civilization. Toward th one place in the world he fears the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan’s car approaches, and comes to a stop. The headlights shining on the old hotel. IT IS CONDEMNED. Dark, boarded up. The decades of NEGLECT DECAY evident in its crumbling form, the once grand hedge maze just overgrown. A foot of snow on the ground, almost enough to make the r impassable. But somehow, they’ve made it. Dan climbs out of the car. Face pale.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: There it is. Abra joins him.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is what we’re going to do. You're going to stay in the car, keep the heater running. I don’t want you spending a minute inside there if you don’t have to. He points down the road, following it as it snakes around adjacent mountain.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She can only come this way. You'll see her a mile out, easy. You see lights on the mountain, over there... you blast me, okay? And I‘1l meet you in the lobby.  116.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You aren’t waiting with me?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I can’t, I’m afraid.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Because I’ve got to go wake it up. She climbs back into the car, starting the engine. And Da Torrance walks through the snow, toward the Overlook Hote

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera FLOATS through the lobby. The hotel is TERRIBL DAMAGED, dark. Mold and water damage everywhere. Rotted boards on the windows. This isn’t a hotel... it’s a carca LOUD BANGS at the front doors. They get louder as we get closer... and then we see the door GIVE WAY as Dan forces way inside. He walks in, looking around. The silence of t place overwhelming. He looks to his left, toward the ELEVATORS... long out of order. Dark.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Wakey wakey. He stands in the lobby, waiting. Waiting. And then... A FEW OF THE LIGHTS START TO SHINE, VERY DIM. Almost imperceptible. Just a FAINT CURRENT running through old wires... He nods. Good. He starts to walk further into the hotel. INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL, BLUE HALLWAYS —- LATER Dan walks the path his tricycle took so many years ago. P THE KITCHEN WALLS, now grimy and rotted. Into the next corridor, turning left -- REVEALING A HALL WITH FAMILIAR BLUE FLORAL WALLPAPER, som it peeling. He walks, looking up at the LIGHT FIXTURES, watching as they continue to HUM WITH WEAK LIGHT... LIGHT HE’S PROVIDING, as he continues to feed the hotel more po  117. He reaches the corner, and HESITATES BEFORE HE TURNS. We hesitate too... we know what once stood on the other side Dan turns the corner, revealing A DARK HALL. The familiar window at the end... but no little girls in blue dresses. keeps walking. Around him, the lights CONTINUE TO STRUGGL BACK TO LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rounds another corner. Looking past the stairwell, at used to be the living quarters... THE DOOR BROKEN APART. BY AN AXE. Hanging lazily open on hinge. He approaches the door, slowly PUSHING IT OPEN. Stepping into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIVING ROOM. He can see the BEDROOM beyond it, all ro by time. He moves slowly into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- bedroom, and looks at the BATHROOM DOOR. The childish SCRIBBLING, FADED, ON THE DOOR: REDRUM. And above it, the GIANT HOLE created by his father’s axe. approaches it. Bringing his face CLOSE TO THE GAP, lookin through the broken door, just as his father once did... To the little window, where he’d once crawled out into th snow outside. He stares sadly at the room... And then tur walking back through the residence, into the dark hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan steps into the darkness of the boiler room. Dusty, co Dark. He heads to the boiler, and starts TURNING VALVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan moves down the hallway outside the GOLD ROOM. Realizi there is LIGHT COMING FROM INSIDE...  118. He steps into the double doors, looking past the TABLES A CHAIRS, toward the BROKEN STAGE at the front of the room. then seeing the source of the light... THE BAR. At the far end of the room. LIT PERFECTLY from below, an EMPTY GLASS on the bar. WAITING FOR HIM. And after a long beat, he approaches the bar. Past the formerly grand ball room, now dilapidated. He arrives, sitting at one of the stools. Staring at the glass.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Slow night, Mister Torrance. In front of him, his back to us, a BARTENDER wipes glasse

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not for long, I imagine.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: You're a whiskey man, are you not?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I was. Most of the time. The bartender turns to him. We don’t see his face, but we Dan’s expression as he’s poured a glass of JACK DANIELS. always knew this day would come, somehow.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: On the house.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thanks, dad. We PULL BACK. Revealing the bartender... it is JACK TORRA (40's). Dressed sharply, the same red tuxedo, the same bl bowtie, that LLOYD wore. Part of the staff now.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you’ve confused me with someone else. It’s Lloyd.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Lloyd.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I apologize, I’m not sure where everyone is. But it’1l pick up.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
