dialogues.text: I know where they are. And you're right, it’ll pick up. (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This was your brand, Jack Daniels. I used to see the bottles at home - our real home, before all this. Mom would find them, hidden sometimes. I smelled one once. Smelled like something on fire. Which, I suppose, it was.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Would you care for something else?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What’s the old saying? “The ideal man doesn't smoke, doesn't drink, doesn't get angry --”

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: “Doesn't exist.”

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Very good. If you don’t mind my saying, Mister Torrance, you seem... Put upon.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Put upon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ain’t that the way. Man just living his life, trying to do his work, gets put upon. Pulled into other people’s problems, I see it all the time. If you don’t mind my saying.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) So we lived in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Mom and I. We never wanted to see snow again so we lived in Florida. Tiny place, but comfortable and we were happy. I mean we were grieving, we were traumatized, but there was happiness too. He stares at the drink. Wanting it so bad.  120.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was twenty when she died. And not my best self, not by a mile. She saw it, saw you, in me, but she loved me through it. Then she got sick and back then I’d see - when someone was gonna die - I'd see flies. Black flies. Death flies, I called them, circling people’s faces, landing now and then and those last weeks she was covered. Her whole face. Could barely see her eyes through them, and I’d try to comfort her but I could hardly look at her and she saw that. Laid there dying while her son... avoided looking... Jack PUSHES the drink gently toward him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Maybe something warm, to push away such unpleasantries -

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to hear? I mean, she was your wife. You loved her in your way, I know that. Don’t you want to hear about her last days? What she said about you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I think you’ve mistaken me for someone else. I’m just a bartender.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Right. Lloyd the bartender: pouring joy at the Overlook Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I‘1l pour whatever you'd like, Mister Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: This drink costs an awful lot.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Your money’s no good here. Orders from the house.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Won’t cost money. It’ll cost me eight years. Eight behind me, and who knows how many in front of me.  121.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Your credit is fine, Mister Torrance. Dan turns the glass. Rolling the booze around within.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: When the others started coming back - and they all did, over the years - I expected you’d have your turn. Thought I’d turn a corner and there you'd be. Maybe with the axe. Maybe typing away, hunched over your old typewriter in the other room. Maybe frozen in the snow... but you didn’t come.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Perhaps a bourbon. We have an extensive collection. Dan picks up the glass. Turns it over in his hand. Wantin it, more than he’s wanted a drink in a long time...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: “Man takes a drink... the drink takes a drink... then the drink takes the man.” Ain’t it so, dad? I wonder, frankly, what our lives would have been - what our family would have been - without this --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Medicine. Jack stares him down. Something has CHANGED in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Medicine, is what it is. A bonafide cure-all. Depression, stress, failure, remorse, it wipes it all out. The mind is a blackboard and that’s the eraser and it’s good, good medicine, Dan. Jack leans forward, takes the glass from him. KNOCKS IT B

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A man tries, he provides, but he’s surrounded by mouths. Mouths that eat, cry, scream, nag - so he asks for one thing. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing, just for him, to warm him up, take the sting out of days of those mouths eating and eating and eating everything he makes. Everything he has. And a family, a wife, a kid - those mouths eat time. Eat your days on earth. Gobble them up, chew them to paste and even then, while they’re still chewing they scream at you. Shout for more, tell you you’re wrong, don’t even bother to say “thank you.” Just eat, and whine until you’re empty and done. He POURS ANOTHER. Pushes it to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Enough to make a man sick. And this is the medicine. So tell me, pup. You gonna take your medicine? He waits. Dan leans back. Afraid.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m not -- 122. Jack SMASHES THE GLASS out of the way. The liquor FLIES O SPLASHING onto Dan’s shirt. Jack stares him down... a warm smile appears, out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh! Look at that, I’m sorry, clumsy old me, Mister Torrance. Forgive me. Let’s get you cleaned up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan looks up, DISORIENTED. He’s in the RED BATHROOM his father leaning over the SINK and wetting a hand moves to Dan, starting to wipe up the spill.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Management is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Concerned.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: About the girl. In the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’ll bet. and then suddenly, towel. He  123.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Horrible, what she’s done to you. Pulled you into her mess. A smart man, he’d let her handle it. Let things unfold as they’re meant to, sit it out.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Management would do well to understand... the girl is protected.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why should you pay her tab, Doc? He looks into Dan’s eyes. The same darkness.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I did it wrong. With you. I was just trying to make you tough. Make you a man I could be proud of.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I believe I am.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You messed up, Danny. Got two men killed. Good men. Men who took a stand. Fought. And for what? For this little girl, who started all this trouble. Pulled you, and them, into her mess.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: And what does management think I should do about that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Nothing. Easiest thing in the world to do, son. Bring her inside. And then... well, accept the things you cannot change. And you and I can sit at the bar, have a drink. That’s what you’ve always wanted, isn’t it? Dan stares at him. About to answer when --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He SNAPS to attention. Looking toward the door.  124.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dan, she’s here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra climbs out of the car. Around her, the snow is FALLI HARDER. Across the mountain, she watches as HEADLIGHTS CL the precarious mountain path. She stares at the approaching RV, still a few minutes awa Dan steps out of the front doors, walking toward her. She points to the lights.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay. He looks back at the hotel. Inside, MORE AND MORE LIGHTS on. He looks from the dark building to the approaching li on the road... danger to either side of him. He holds out his hand, and Abra takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Abra step inside. Abra looks around the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: This place is sick. The same way my Momo was sick... it’s cancer. Only worse. He turns, crouching down to her.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You should call your mom. Tell her where you are. By the time she gets here...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: It’ll be over.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: One way or the other. Abra CLOSES HER EYES. Concentrates. As she does... Dan notices the LIGHTS SWELL in the lobby. Coming up to FULL POWER. FEEDING OFF HER SHINE.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Okay. Done. What do we do now?  125.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We head inside. She’ll find us. They start walking toward the corridors. As Abra steps in Dan STOPS. Looking at something on the wall... A FIRE AXE. IN A DIRTY GLASS CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose steps through the snow, looking up at the hotel. The lights FULLY BRIGHT inside, shining through the old board over the windows. THE HOTEL IS AWAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose the Hat walks into the lobby of the Overlook Hotel. moves slowly, taking in her surroundings. Feeling the POW of the place. She looks toward the elevators, and for just a moment -- a FLASH of BLOOD, soaking the entire lobby. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose walks the corridors, past the closed doors. She RUNS FINGERS along the walls, glancing down at the familiar CR PATTERN CARPETING as she goes deeper into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose steps into the iconic COLORADO LOUNGE. Looking at th OLD PIANO... the LONG DESK just beyond it, in the center the room. The desk with the OLD TYPEWRITER, rusted and du And beyond it... to the STAIRCASE. Where DAN stands, Abra his side. Waiting for her. Dan holding THE FIRE AXE.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Well hi there. Dan leans toward Abra.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (in Abra’s mind) When this starts, you run.  126.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Yes, you run, dear. Then I’1l find you. And you’1ll scream for years before you die.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: We'll see who does the screaming.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We'll see indeed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She's right, you know. You should be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You don’t know where you’re standing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Who are you, handsome? Dan doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I get it, you’re scared. You should be... you’re the man who killed my Crow, aren’t you. Dan nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The others too.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to Abra) Go. In that moment, Rose GRABS HER EARS as a HIGH-PITCHED RIN erupts in her skull. The room GOES BLURRY, and she STUMBL to one knee. After a moment, she shouts --

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH.
dialogues.text: The sound of someone HITTING THE GROUND. Rose looks up, B running from her nose. On the stairs, Dan is LYING ON HIS SIDE, pushing himself back up. Abra is GONE, having run i the hotel during his distraction.  127. Rose gets to her feet, walking toward Dan as he rises, picking up the axe.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How the hell did we miss you? You and I should have met years ago, Danny. That’s your name, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I was busy. So were you... busy killing children.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Something happens to the steam, when you rubes get older. It gets dirty. Polluted. You know that, I see the grease all over you. You don’t “Shine” quite the same, do you. Growing up spoils that, I guess. But seriously, handsome, where have you been hiding. He raises the axe defensively as she STARTS CLIMBING THE STAIRS. Slowly, STALKING him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can make you an offer. An offer I rarely make.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Can’t wait. Dan starts slowly BACKING UP THE STAIRS. Rose follows, an they slowly climb... just as Jack and Wendy did years ago

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Such a gifted boy. Hiding his light under a bushel, for so long. You could live a long, long time. Live well, too. Indulge yourself. No consequence. No hangovers. Live long, eat well.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Must feel lonely. Being the last one, I mean. Last one in the world.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Oh sweetie, I’m not the last. Far from it. I’m just the prettiest. Dan reaches the top step. Rose looks up at him, smiling.  128.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I assume you know my answer.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Pity. (beat) So are we doing this or not? A long beat... and then a BLAST OF NOISE in Rose’s head. RUSHES toward her, RAISING THE AXE -- ANOTHER BLAST, THIS ONE IN DAN’S MIND --

dialogues.speaker: HE FALTERS, SWINGING THE AXE DOWN TOWARD HER HEAD --
dialogues.text: SHE CATCHES THE HANDLE, just below the blade, DEFLECTING INTO HER OWN SHOULDER. She RIPS the blade out, RIPPING IT from Dan’s hands -- SWINGING IT DOWN, BURYING THE BLADE INTO HIS THIGH. She G HIM around the neck, HURLING HIM UP OFF HIS FEET, OVER HE HEAD -- AND HURLS HIM DOWN THE STAIRS. He lands HARD, bouncing from the stairs, landing at the bottom with a THUD. His leg BLEEDING PROFUSELY. Rose slowly descends the staircase, blood flowing from he collarbone. Axe in hand. EYES BURNING WITH INHUMAN LIGHT. crouches over him. Looking at his wound.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, sweetie. I seem to have nicked your femoral artery. You’re gonna bleed to death. He tries to sit up, she SMASHES the back of the axe into HEAD, knocking him back. GRABS his throat. PUSHING HIM BA with INHUMAN STRENGTH. He’s OUTMATCHED.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My, my, what a temper you have. So much fire. You sure I can’t tempt you? Turn all that fire and steam into a long, blessed life... or do you want to die here on the floor?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We don’t die. We go on.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Fair enough. Such a waste... or Maybe not.  129. She DIGS HER FINGERS into his leg wound, and he SCREAMS. tightens her grip on his throat, leaning close to him. He fingers DIG in the wound, and he SCREAMS LOUDER... And then, a FAINT CLOUD OF GREY STEAM escapes his mouth. Rising in the air. Rose greedily INHALES IT.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn, even at your age... it’s so good. You taste like whiskey. She DIGS IN HARDER, and Dan SCREAMS LOUDER. As he does --

dialogues.speaker: AXE IN HAND. THE WOMAN IN THE TUB, RISING.
dialogues.text: Rose INHALES another breath of Dan’s steam.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So much terror, all your life. Delicious. You do Shine - that’s the word you like, isn’t it? And so does the little bitch. But honey, neither one of you can hold a candle. To me. She releases his neck, GRABBING HIS HEAD with fingers as strong (and suddenly as sharp) as TALONS. She SQUEEZES HI SKULL as she DIGS MORE into his leg. Dan SCREAMS IN AGONY

dialogues.speaker: LOCKED BOXES, LIKE COFFINS.
dialogues.text: Rose BREATHES IN MORE STEAM. Eyes blazing, ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (realizing) You’re not alone in there. What are you hiding? She SQUEEZES HIS HEAD HARDER. Dan SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s in those? Something special?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You don’t know where you’re standing.  130.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You said that. What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I mean you’re right. I Shine, and Abra Shines even more than me. But neither of us Shine as much as you... and you’re standing in the one place -- the worst place -- for someone who Shines. Rose looks at him, her smile fading as --

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: He GRINS, and for a moment, it’s HIS FATHER’S GRIN.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The things in those boxes aren’t just special... they’re starving. Rose looks down at him, not understanding -- and over her shoulder, we see the rotten, EMACIATED FACE OF MRS. MASSE

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT, STARVING. STARING AT ROSE --
dialogues.text: MRS. MASSEY POUNCES. She KNOCKS ROSE TO THE FLOOR, and we realize she ISN'T ALONE -- DOZENS OF GHOSTS DESCEND ON THEM. All SCREAMING WITH HUNG faces GAUNT AND STARVING. We recognize most of them - HOR DERWENT. DELBERT GRADY. THE INHABITANTS OF THE OVERLOOK. Rose SCREAMS as they CLIMB ONTO HER, desperate for FOOD - CLAWING, DIGGING. Their hands DISAPPEAR INTO HER BODY. Th desperately DIG INTO HER, LOOKING FOR ANYTHING TO QUENCH

dialogues.speaker: THEIR DECADES OF HUNGER --
dialogues.text: Rose STRUGGLES. Fighting with everything she has to keep back, SCREAMING IN SURPRISE AND PAIN -- But it’s no use. The hollow eyes and gaping mouths of the ghosts surround her, descending on her just as the True K did to Bradley Trevor. Rose looks one last time at Dan, FURY AND RAGE in her anc eyes. Unable to believe that she is beaten... by HIM. He STARES HER DOWN. Holds eye contact, even as the ghosts PLUNGE THEIR HANDS into her chest. One last look of hatre from Rose -- AND THEN SHE STARTS TO CYCLE. Her skin becoming TRANSLUCE we can see their GHOSTLY FINGERS INSIDE OF HER, PULLING A HER HEART, HER BLOOD --—  131. She THRASHES BENEATH THEM, HER SKULL SHINING THROUGH HER

dialogues.speaker: SKIN, TWISTING INTO THE INHUMAN MONSTER SHE TRULY IS --
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS ONE LAST TIME, as STEAM BEGINS TO POUR OUT OF MOUTH AND NOSE. The ghosts INHALING IT HUNGRILY -- And then she BURSTS APART in a cloud of silver STEAM. The steam is ABSORBED by the inhabitants of the OVERLOOK, who greedily GULP IT IN -- SOME OF IT ABSORBED BY THE VERY CARPET, being digested by hotel itself -- And then, she is gone. The ghosts’ gaunt faces EXPAND, their features BECOMING RESTORED, the years of starvation DISAPPEARING as they inherit all of her strength. Dan tries to SIT UP as they turn their attention to him.

dialogues.speaker: ADVANCE, GRINNING THEIR DEAD SMILES --
dialogues.text: Dan CLOSES HIS EYES, CONCENTRATING -- A FLASH OF THE LOCK BOXES, he wants to LOCK THEM AWAY AGA But they are ON HIM before he can do anything. He STRUGGL in their grip, and as a DEAD HAND closes over his mouth - WE SEE HIS EYES ROLL BACK WHITE as the Overlook POURS ITS INTO HIS MIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra looks up as the LIGHT FIXTURES SWELL with new ENERGY From somewhere deep in the hotel, THE SOUND OF MUSIC. Old music, ECHOING THROUGH THE HALLS. She slowly walks, SCARE

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Uncle Dan? Just the sound of music. She moves slowly, afraid, and tu the corner to see -- TWO GIRLS, IN BLUE DRESSES. HOLDING HANDS. STARING AT HER. She STARES AT THEM. Terrified. The girls stare back, thei expressions BLANK... As SOMEONE STEPS INTO THE HALL BEHIND ABRA. She turns at SHUFFLING SOUND of their entrance... It’s DAN, head down. THE AXE IN HIS HANDS.  132.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uncle Dan! Is it done? Is she dead... As Abra approaches, he LOOKS UP AT HER. She STOPS COLD. It’s Dan... BUT IT ISN'T. His eyes are DARK. FULL OF VIOLENCE. The same expression his FATHER wore, those year ago, when he TRIED TO KILL HIS FAMILY.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) What’s wrong? He stares at her... AND LIMPS FORWARD. CLUTCHING THE AXE.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Bad girl. Bad little pup...

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Uncle Dan...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You’re gonna take your medicine. As he picks up speed, AXE AT THE READY. HE MEANS TO KILL She backs up, the realization hitting her -- THEN ABRA RU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra turns the corner, moving fast. Around her, the music LOUDER NOW, the lights FLICKERING. Behind her, Dan LIMPS FRANTICALLY along, Axe in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Abra! She runs faster, rounding the corner. Makes it down a familiar hallway... looking over her shoulder. She’s ahea him, but he’1l turn the corner any second -- She sees an open door. RUNS INSIDE. As she closes the doo behind her, we tilt up to the room number... ROOM 217.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra slowly backs away from the door, into the familiar r The green walls are FADED, MOLDY. OLD. Keeping quiet, she BACKS INTO THE ROOM. Waiting. She watc as a SHADOW PASSES BY UNDER THE DOOR. Hears Dan’s LABORED BREATHS as he looks for her.  133.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Abra!!! After a few moments, he passes, and she listens to him walking away. Barely aware THAT SOMEONE IS IN THE BATHTUB IN THE OTHER ROOM. Just over her shoulder. The sound of WATER SLOSHING GENTLY turns her head. She tu to see -- THE SILHOUETTE of a WOMAN, SITTING IN THE TUB. Her hand slowly REACHING UP to pull the curtain back. Abra watches as MRS. MASSEY peels back the curtain, GRINN Abra STEELS herself against the vision. Holds her ground.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Try it. Mrs. Massey STANDS UP. Abra stands, waiting as -- THE DOOR IS SUDDENLY KICKED OPEN. She spins back toward it as DAN STEPS INTO THE ROOM. AXE HAND. GRINNING AT HER.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: There you are. We have to talk, Abra. You’ve been very, very bad.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You’re not Uncle Dan. He stops. Smiling at her.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a mask. A false face.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Who else would I be?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: You’re not him. You’re the hotel. (beat) But he’s still in there. He smirks, and after a beat... lets the mask slip. The fa staring at her is Dan’s, but also something else. SOMETHI DARK. SOMETHING OLD. SOMETHING THAT WANTS HER DEAD.  134.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Masks off, then. Anything else to say? Are you sure you wouldn’t like to run? A game of tag, perhaps? All we have is time, you know. An eternity of time. Or shall we end it? Might as well. After all... we're missing the party. Abra SMILES at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you smiling?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Because you don’t know where you’re standing.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know these halls like my own face, child.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I mean the body you're standing in... the face you’re wearing. That’s Dan Torrance, and you don’t know him. You think he’s still a little boy, and man oh man, are you in for a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Dan Torrance. You mean the same Dan Torrance who was just laying broken at the foot of the stairs?

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I mean the Dan Torrance who made one stop, as soon as he got here. (beat) To the boiler room. Dan’s smile disappears. He didn’t know that... and we can the implication SCARES HIM. He LIFTS THE AXE, SWINGING IT

dialogues.speaker: DOWN AT HER HEAD --
dialogues.text: Abra HOLDS HER GROUND, DOESN’T EVEN FLINCH AS -- THE AXE STOPS. INCHES FROM HER HEAD. Dan holds it, staring at her with a PERPLEXED EXPRESSION. INTERNAL STRUGGLE HAPPENING before our eyes, his hands SHAKING...  135. She reaches up, GENTLY RESTING HER HAND ON HIS, just abov the axe blade. And then, after a long beat... Dan CLOSES EYES. Breathes in... and when he opens them, we see the difference. IT’S DAN AGAIN. THE REAL DAN.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) There you are.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You were supposed to run.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to leave you... Dan smiles, gently.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm right where I’m supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn’t let it hurt me. I could feel it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) Abra... I can’t hold it back much longer though. You have to run.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: No. I’m not going anywhere without you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'll be right behind you. Have to close the door behind us, right? She stares at him, not sure if she believes it. He nods, reassuring. And finally...

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run. Abra turns, RUNNING FROM THE ROOM. Dan holds his ground, gentle smile fading as the HOTEL REGAINS CONTROL. His face is slowly overtaken by PANIC. “Dan” turns, DROPP THE AXE as he RUNS --  136.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- into the boiler room. Heads to the boiler, looking at GAGES -- THE STEAM PRESSURE IS ALREADY IN THE RED. Panick he reaches up to grab the handles... BUT HIS HANDS STOP. Inches from the wheel. His face conto in confusion. DAN, inside, trying to STOP HIS HANDS from relieving the pressure...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (struggling) Are you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra RUNS toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Almost... INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL, BOILER ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Dan’s hands SHAKE over the boiler. His face contorted wit RAGE and anger... With great effort, Dan manages to STEP BACK, AWAY FROM TH BOILER. LOWERING HIS HANDS. Sitting back, WATCHING THE BO OVERLOAD. FLAMES ERUPT FROM THE PIPES. He sighs, knowing it’s over... the fire can’t be stopped He stands and watches, even as the flames SPREAD TOWARD H As they reach him, Dan CLOSES HIS EYES, EXHAUSTED BUT VICTORIOUS. In the firelight, we see his weary SMILE as t FIRE REACHES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra stands in the snow, watching as FLAMES begin to erup from the hotel. She stares, helpless as they SPREAD.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Come on Uncle Dan, get out of there... The FIRE SPREADS FAST... the old, rotten wood and plaster the hotel CATCHING QUICKLY. The flames BUILDING AND BUILD as the snow falls around her.  137.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. On the mountain pass, in the distance, she sees SIRENS fr the APPROACHING POLICE CARS. Her mother brought the caval She turns, looking as the FLAMES ENGULF THE HOTEL... GLOW IN THE SNOW. The fire so large now, bursting through wind Abra waits, and waits. A TEAR rolling down her cheek. Desperate for him to be safe. For it to be over. She wait and waits... As the police cars reach the top of the pass.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The fire spread fast. Destroying the hotel... purifying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abra sits on the foot of her bed.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: Burning so bright I was warm, even in the snow. I could almost hear it screaming. I could hear it dying. And I knew, somewhere deep inside... I knew you were okay. REVEAL DAN. Leaning against the wall. Smiling at her.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I put you in danger. It was the only way.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: I know. (beat) Do you think she was right? When she said she wasn’t the last one. Do you think there are more, somewhere out there? Dan considers this, moving toward the window. Looking out mountains in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The world is a hungry place. A dark place. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And maybe there’s more of them, or things like them, or worse. But there are more people like you too. People who stand. She smiles at him. He looks out at the mountain. The snow the peak, against the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what Rene Daumal said about mountains? “What is above knows what is below, but what is below does not know what is above. One climbs, one sees. One descends, one sees no longer... but one has seen.” (beat) They really are lovely, aren’t they. He turns back to her, the mountain behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you, when we first met... I told you that you should hide, keep your head down. Keep your Shine out of sight. I was wrong about that. (beat) Shine on, Abra Stone. You Shine on. She smiles. In the hallway, Lucy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Abra! Dinner time! (stepping in) Who are you talking to? REVEAL: The room is empty. Abra sits alone.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: No one. INT. ABRA’S HOUSE, UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS Abra stops at the end of the hall. Lucy turns back to her

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: That’s not true. I lied, just now. I was talking to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: We go on. After. We go on. And he’s okay, mom. He really is.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (beat) Good. She heads down the stairs. Abra waits, watching her go. A a few beats... she turns, toward the BATHROOM AT THE END HER HALL. She stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You coming? Through the door, in the dark... we see the SHADOW OF THE

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, SITTING IN THE TUB. BEHIND THE CURTAIN. MRS. MASSE
dialogues.text: come for Abra. As she did for Danny, years ago.

dialogues.speaker: ABRA
dialogues.text: In a minute. She turns, walking down the hall. Relaxed. She steps into bathroom, and slowly turns to CLOSE THE DOOR behind her. she does, ABRA SMILES. FADE TO BLACK.
